aṃsa

masculine shoulder.

aṃsakūṭa

masculine neuter “shoulder prominence”; the shoulder.

aṃsabaddha

masculine a shoulder strap.

aṃsabandhaka

masculine a shoulder strap.

aṃsavaddhaka

masculine a shoulder strap.

aṃsā

feminine (& m. pl.?) a particular disease, hemorrhoids, piles.

akaṃ

1 sg. (see karoti)

akaṃsu

3 plural (see karoti)

akakkasa

mfn. not harsh; not rough; smooth (see kakkasa)

akaṅkha

mfn.

  1. without doubts, without uncertainty.
  2. without desire, with no wishes (see kaṅkhā)
akaṅkhi(n)

mfn. free from doubts, without uncertainty (see kaṅkhi[n])

akaṭa

mfn. not made; not artificial, natural.

akaṭayūsa

masculine neuter untreated soup, bean water without added oil (see akaṭa)

mfn. whose form or arrangement is not made, is not ordered (see akaṭa)

akaṭānudhamma

mfn. not dealt with according to the rule, not restored (see akaṭa)

mfn. ripening in uncultivated ground; growing wild (see kaṭṭha)

mfn. without bran; with the bran removed (see kaṇa)

akaṇika

mfn. free from blemish (see kaṇika)

akaṇṭaka

mfn. free from thorns; free from obstacles; free from rebels or bandits (see kaṇṭaka)

akaṇha

mfn. not dark, light; not evil (see kaṇha)

akata

neg. mfn & neuter not made, not done; not manufactured, not treated, natural; not fashioned; what has not been done; what is not made ( nibbāna) (see kata)

neg. mfn. (see katupāsana)

akutobhaya

akuppa

neg. mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) not able to be disturbed; stable; immovable; not open to challenge or valid objection.
  2. (n.) what is not able to be disturbed; (a state of) stability.
  3. lack of agitation; (the state of) not being provoked or angered, forbearance (see kuppa)

  2. (mfn.) not good at, incompetent; not skilled, not expert; not knowledgeable about or conversant with (see kusala)

agga

mfn. & n.

  1. (mfn.) the first, foremost; topmost; better; excellent, illustrious; the best, chief (very often iic); (n.) the best part; the ideal; a most excellent thing; the best of its class or type.
  2. (n.m.) the top, point; tip.
aggakārikā

feminine (first or best action); a first taste; a sample (see agga)

aggakulika

mf(n). (one) belonging to the an esteemed or chief family (see agga)

agga-m-agga

mfn. the very best; the most excellent.

aggaṅkuraka

neuter the top shoot (see agga)

aggañña

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) chief, principal; primitive, original.
  2. (n.) the beginning of things; origin (see agga)
agaṇhanta

mfn. (see gaṇhāti), pg 14 Ga-Na.

aggatā

feminine abstr. preeminence; chief position.

aggato

abl. before; in front; in the presence of (see agga)

aggadana

neuter a gift of the best; the best gift (see agga)

aggadvāra

masculine the top of the door or gate; (or the first gate opened; a way to leave the town secretly).

aggadhamma

masculine the best doctrine; the best state or condition (see agga)

agganakha

masculine the tip of the nail (see agga)

agganagara

neuter a chief city; the chief city.

aggapaññati

feminine designation as best (of its class) (see agga)

aggapada

neuter the best word, the best teaching; the best state or place (see agga)

aggapiṇḍa

masculine the first or best food (see agga)

aggapuggala

masculine the best of men (see agga)

aggapurisa

m the best or the preeminent person (see agga)

agga(p)pasāda

masculine the best trust; trust in the best.

aggabīja

neuter a plant propagated by cuttings (see agga)

aggarasaparititta

mfn. completely satisfied with the best flavored foods (see agga)

aggala

masculine neuter

  1. a bolt or bar for fastening a door (or window); the doorpanel or door.
  2. a patch (see also aggaḷa)
aggalaṭṭhapana

neuter the placing or vising of a door-bolt or door-panel (see aggala)

aggalaphalaka

neuter the panel of a door (see aggala)

aggalavaṭṭi

aggalasūci

aggaḷa

  1. a bolt or bar for fastening a door (or window); the doorpanel or door.
  2. a patch (see also aggala)
aggava(t)

mfn. of great eminence, excellent (see agga)

aggavādi(n)

m(fn). (one) who proclaims the highest, the best (see agga)

aggasavaka

masculine a chief disciple (see agga)

aggahīta

mfn. kept back (see gaṇhāti)

aggahetvā

ind. seizing.

aor. 3 sg. (see gaṇhāti)

2 sg. (see gaṇhāti)

aggahesiṃ

1 sg. (see gaṇhāti)

aggahesum

3 plural (see gaṇhāti)

aggāsana

neuter the first or chief seat (see agga)

aggi

masculine

  1. fire; flames; conflagration.
  2. cremation fire; a pyre (as or deal or suicide).
  3. the ritual fire, the sacrificial fire; (one of) the three fires of brahmanical ritual; the god Aggi Bhagavā.
  4. (metaphorically) mental fire, fever.
aggikkhandha

masculine a great mass of fire; a huge blazing fire, a bonfire (see aggi)

aggiṭṭhāna

neuter a place for the fire; a fireplace, hearth (see aggi)

aggipajjota

masculine light from a fire (see aggi)

aggipāricariyā

feminine attendance on, or care of, the ritual fire (see aggi)

aggipāricārika

mfn. who tends the ritual fire (see aggi)

aggiparicitta

mfn. damaged by fire (see aggi)

aggiparijita

mfn. (same as aggiparicitta)

aggi-m-āsīna

mfn. sitting near a fire (see aggi)

aggisādhārana

mfn. subject to, vulnerable to, fire (see aggi)

aggisālā

feminine a fire-room (where water is heated), a heated hall; a room for the ritual fire (see aggi)

aggisikhā

feminine a flame; a crest of a fire.

aggihutta

neuter the oblation to Agni, the rite of the fire oblation; the ritual fire (see aggi)

aggihuttamissa

neuter various tools etc. for the fire-oblation (see aggihutta)

aggihuttamukha

neuter for which the fire-oblation is the chief or foremost (see aggihutta)

aggihoma

neuter oblation in the fire (see aggi)

aggika

m(fn). [from aggi] one who tends the ritual fire (see also aggiya)

aggiya

m(fn). [from aggi] one who tends the ritual fire (see also aggika)

agginisama

mfn. & neuter filled (to the brim) with fire; being a mass of fire; a mass of fire.

aggupaṭṭhāka

masculine the chief personal (male) attendant (see agga)

aggha1

masculine price; worth.

aggha2

masculine neuter hospitality, respectful reception of a guest; an offering of water etc. to a guest.

agghati

pr. 3 sg. is worth, has the value of; deserves; frequently in phrase kalaṃ na agghati (soḷasiṃ), is not worth a (sixteenth) part (of).

agghanaka

mf(-ikā)n. having the value of, worth (see also agghanikā).

agghanikā

mf(-ikā)n. having the value of, worth (see also agghanaka).

agghāpenta

part. pr. mfn. valuing; putting a price on (see agghati)

agghāpesi

aor. 3 sg. valued; put a price on (see agghati)

agyantarāya

m danger from fire.

agyāgāra

masculine a hut for the (ritual) fire(s).

agha1

neuter (& m.) & mfn.

  1. (n. m) wicked; pain, distress.
  2. (mfn.) bad; dangerous.
agha2

neuter (& m. or mfn.?) (?) the air, the sky; space; (void, unrestricted?).

aghagata1

neuter wicked; distress (see aggha)

aghagata2

neuter sky; space (see aggha)

aghagāmi(n)

mfn. moving through the sky, through the space (see aggha)

aghāvi(n)

mfn. being in misery; suffering pain.

aṅka

masculine

  1. the lap.
  2. the hollow above the hips where infants are carried.
aṅkusa

masculine a hook for controlling and driving an elephant, a goad.

aṅkusagayha

neuter [from aṅkusaggaha] the art of elephant driving (see aṅkusa)

aṅkusaggaha

masculine “one who holds the hook”, an elephant driver (see aṅkusa)

aṅga

neuter ( & m.) a part of the body; a limb, member; an integral part of anything; a constituent part of a whole, a subordinate division; a limb or aspect of something as a characteristic sign, an attribute, a quality; as a determining characteristic or factor, a cause; iminā p’ aṅgena, with that characteristic; in that way; for that reason.

aṅgajāta

neuter the male or female genitals.

aṅgaṇa1

neuter a place to walk in; open space, a court; a clearing.

aṅgaṇa2

neuter a speck of dirt; a blemish; a moral blemish, defilements.

aṅga-m-aṅgāni

neuter plural limb by limb; all the limbs (see aṅga)

aṅgapaccaṅga

neuter & mfn. one limb or another; one limb after another; all the limbs or parts (see aṅga)

aṅgarāga

masculine unguents or cosmetics for the body (see aṅga)

aṅgavata

masculine rheumatism (see aṅga)

aṅgavijjā

feminine the art of prognosticating from parts of, or marks on, the body (see aṅga)

aṅgāra

masculine neuter charcoal; heated charcoal; embers.

aṅgārakaṭāha

neuter a pot or pan for burning charcoal; a fire-pan; a brazier (see aṅgāra)

aṅgārakāsu

feminine a charcoal pit (with burning coal) (see aṅgāra)

aṅgāri(n)

mfn. covered in crimson.

aṅgi(n)

mfn. having limbs or parts; having a body; who has limbs.

aṅguṭṭha

masculine the thumb; the big toe.

aṅguṭṭhapada

neuter a thumb-mark (see anguṭṭha)

aṅgula

masculine neuter a finger.

aṅgulī

feminine a finger (often in pi. including the thumb); (occasionally) a toe.

aṅgulīchinna

mfn. whose finger has been cut off (see aṅgulī)

aṅgulīpatodaka

masculine poking with the finger; tickling (see aṅgulī)

aṅgulīpada

neuter a finger-mark (see aṅgulī)

aṅgulimuddikā

feminine a signet ring (see aṅgulī)

acakkhuka

mfn. without sight; blind; without insight, without understanding.

acittaka

mfn. without intention, without awareness.

acīvaraka

m(fn.) (one) who has no bhikkhu’s robes.

acc-

prefix is the usual form of the prefix ati- before vowels other than ī. In words of more than three syllables the vowel following acc- is often strengthened.

accagamā

aor. 3 sg. overcame.

accaguṃ
accagū

aor. 3 sg. surpassed, overcame.

accaṅkusa

mfn. beyond the control of the goad.

accatari

aor. 3 sg. (see atitarati)

accatāri

aor. 3 sg. (see atitarati)

accanta

mfn. beyond the (usual) end or limit; excessive, very great; perpetual; absolute, complete; most commonly accantaṃ, adv., excessively, exceedingly; perpetually. absolutely, completely.

accantadussīlya

neuter extremely bad conduct (see accanta)

accantaniṭṭha

mfn. of absolute, constant perfection or firmness (see accanta)

accantapariyosāna

mfn. having an absolute, constant ideal (see accanta)

accantabrahmacāri(n)

mfn. living the holy or celibate life absolutely, constantly (see accanta)

accantayogakkhemi(n)

mfn. having absolute, constant peace from exertion (see accanta)

accantaruci

mfn. having superior splendor, surpassing in splendor (see accanta)

accaya

m. instr.

  1. (instr.) ~ena, and, more rarely, abl. ~ā, loc. ~e (+ gen. or ifc),
    1. after the lapse (of) at the end (of), after.
    2. after the death (of).
  2. going beyond (the norm); transgression; offense.
accayaṃ deseti

(?) confesses to an offense (as being such) (see accaya)

accayaṃ paṭigaṇhāti

(?) accepts (the confession of) the fault, pardons the offense (see accaya)

accayaṃ passati

(?) recognizes an offense (as being such) (see accaya)

accayato deseti

(?) confesses to an offense (as being such) (see accaya)

accayato paṭigaṇhāti

(?) accepts (the confession of) the fault, pardons the offense (see accaya)

accayato passati

(?) recognizes an offense (as being such) (see accaya)

accayo maṃ (no) accagamā

(?) a fault has overcome me (us), i.e. has been committed by me (us) (see accaya)

accarucī

aor. 3 sg. (see atirocati)

accasarā

2 sg. give offense.

accasarī

aor. 3 sg. gave offense.

accādhāya

absol. putting on top of; on top of.

accāyata

mfn. very much stretched or extended; over-strung (opposite to atisithila); high, sharp.

accāyika

mfn. urgent; pressing (see also acceka)

accāraddha

mfn. undertaken or practiced excessively.

accāraddhaviriya

neuter & mfn.

  1. (n.) to great exertion.
  2. (mfn.) exerting oneself too much (see accāraddha)
accāvadati

pr. 3 sg. speaks or addresses in an excessive or improper way; (tries to) surpass in speaking.

accāvadanta

accāvadittha

accāvadimha

accāsanne

acchibaddha

accī

accīma(t)

mfn. flaming, glowing; brilliant.

accukkaṭṭha

mfn. (a a robe) pulled up too high.

accuggata

mfn. risen out (of); raised high; high, tall; lofty; haughty.

accuggamamma

  2. (n.) excessive heat.

acceka

accekacīvara

  2. goes beyond; oversteps; overcomes; becomes free of.

accharā

  2. (n. [and m.]) a wonderful thing; a marvel.
acchariyaṃ

acchariyamanussa

masculine a wonderful exceptional man (see acchariya)

aja

masculine a goat; (m.) a male goat, a billy-goat (see also ajā)

ajaka

masculine (& ~ā f.?) a young goat.

ajaddhumārikā

ajikakkhāyita

ajina

neuter the hairy skin of an animal; esp. the skin of the black antelope (worn as a garment and used as a covering by ascetics).

ajinakkhipa

ajinappaveṇī

ajinasāṭī

feminine a garment made of skins (see ajina)

ajeḷakā

neuter goats and sheep; (perhaps two kinds of goats?) (see aja)

ajja

ind. today; now; just now; at the present time.

ajjuka

masculine neuter name of a plant, perhaps white basil.

ajjatagge

ind. henceforth; from this day forth.

ajjatana

mfn. & masculine

  1. (mfn.) referring or belonging to today; modern; present.
  2. (m.) the period of the current day; this day, today.
ajjatā

feminine the present time (see ajja)

ajjadagge

ind. from this day onward.

ājjava

masculine neuter [from uju] uprightness; straightness.

ajjasaṭṭhim

ind. since six days ago, for six days (see ajja)

ajjuṇho

ind. this day; the rest of this day and night.

  2. (n. [& m.?]) the direct road or way.

añña

mfn. pron. other; different; other than (+ abl.); another, a further, one more; somebody, something else; anything else; pl. (the) others, the rest.

añña…añña

(?)

  1. one… another…; some… some.
  2. one … another (different) …; one thing … another thing … (see añña)
aññañña

mfn. pron. each other (see añña)

añña-m-añña

mfn. pron.

  1. one another; each other.
  2. one after the other; now one… now another…; various, different.
añña-m-aññaṃ

adv. towards one another; mutually, reciprocally (see añña-m-añña)

añña-m-aññakhādikā

feminine the eating of one another (see añña-m-añña)

aññakanthika

mfn. acquiescing in different views (see añña)

aññacetāpana

neuter ~ā, feminine asking for something else; exchanging for something else (?) (see añña)

aññatama

mfn. one out of many; one or other of.

aññatara

mfn. pron.

  1. one of two; one of several; a certain… (often used as indefinite article: ‘a’); somebody, some….
  2. other, another; different.
aññataraññatara

mfn. one or other; all kinds (see aññatara)

aññatitthiya

mfn. & masculine belonging to another sec; a non-Buddhist (see añña)

aññato

ind.

  1. from another, from somebody else; elsewhere; from elsewhere.
  2. as another (thing), as different.
aññattha

ind. somewhere else, anywhere else, elsewhere.

aññatthācariyaka

mfn. following a different teaching (see aññattha)

aññatra

ind.

  1. elsewhere, somewhere else; in another place.
  2. but for, besides, except, apart from; without (with abl. or instr. [and acc.?]).
aññatra … aññatra …

(?) in one place … in another … (see aññatra)

aññatrācariyaka

mfn. following a different teaching (see aññatra)

aññatrayoga

mfn. following another discipline or religious practice (see aññatra)

aññathatta

neuter abstr. change, alteration; change of mind; doubt, anxiety (see aññathā)

aññathā

ind. in a different manner; otherwise (than, abl.); in the wrong way, falsely, erroneously; not so.

aññathā … aññathā …

(?) in one way … in another way …; like this … different… (see aññathā)

aññathācariyaka

mfn. following a different teaching (see aññathā)

aññathābhava

masculine becoming different; change, alteration (see aññathā)

aññathābhāvi(n)

masculine of changeable nature, inevitably changing (see aññathā)

añña-d-attha

masculine another object or aim (see añña)

añña-d-atthika

mfn. having another object or purpose (see añña)

aññadatthu

ind. only, exclusively, absolutely; merely; rather, on the contrary.

aññadatthuṃ

ind. (see aññadatthu)

aññadatthudasa

m(fn.) seeing absolutelyl the only seer ( of Brahmā or Tathāgata) (see aññadatthu)

aññadatthuhara

mfn. who merely, only takes (see aññadatthu)

aññadā

ind. at another time, at other times.

aññadiṭṭhika

mfn. having different views (see añña)

aññape(k)kha

mfn. wishing for knowledge, wanting to know (see aññā)

aññamokkha

mfn. to be released by another (see añña)

aññāvada

masculine a statement of what is known (?).

aññavadaka

masculine & neuter

  1. (m.) one who speaks about something else, a prevaricator.
  2. (n.) the offense of prevaricating (see añña)
aññavadī(n)

mfn. professing another doctrine (see añña)

aññavihita

mfn. being occupied with something else (see añña)

aññavihitaka

mfn. occupied with something else; (repeated) directed to one thing … directed to another … (see añña)

aññā

feminine knowledge, philoso phic insight; perfect knowledge i.e. arahantship.

aññāṃ vyākaroti

(?) proclaims one’s arahatship (see aññā)

aññācitta

neuter thought for knowledge, the intention of gaining perfect knowledge (see aññā)

aññāṇa

neuter knowledge.

aññāṇaka

neuter ignorance; lack of understanding.

aññāta(r)

masculine one who knows, who understands; a knower.

aññātaka

mfn. unknown; unfamiliar.

aññātakavesena

adv. in disguise; not in one owns form.

aññātāvi(n)

mfn. who has complete insight; (completely understood?).

aññātāvindriya

mfn. of another kind; different (see añña)

aññindriya

neuter the faculty of knowing (see aññā)

aññoññavivaresi(n)

part. pr. mfn. (see asnāti)

aṭaṭa

feminine part of a bed or chair (probably the rails forming the frame).

feminine having several linings (of a certain kind of shoe).

  1. characterised by eight parts (i.e. by observance of the first eight precepts); having eight constituent parts.
  2. possessed of eight good qualities or of eight faults (see aṭṭha)

mfn. well joined or endowed with eight parts (see aṭṭha)

aṇṇava

masculine neuter the sea, the ocean; a stream.

atappa

masculine plural the name of one of the highest classes of devas, the second class of suddhāvāsa devas.

ati-

prefix prefix to nouns, adjectives, adverbs; preverb to verbs; before vowels (except ī-) generally, but not always, taking the form acc-;

  1. as prefix to nouns expresses: abundance, excess, superiority, transgression; the being beyond (the reach of).
  2. as prefix to adjectives, adverbs expresses: very much, too much.
  3. as preverb to verbs and their derivatives expresses: beyond, over; through; too much, very much, too far.
  4. ati is sometimes inserted in iterative compounds expressing: and, adding further, even more, etc.
ati-uṇha

mfn. too hot; very hot (see uṇha)

atikata

mfn. more than repaid; paid back excessively (see kata)

atikaḍḍhati

pr. 3 sg. pulls or presses too much or very much; harasses (?).

atikaṇha

mfn. too dark (see kaṇha)

atikālassa

(?) very early; too early (see kālassa)

atikāle

(?) very early; too early (see kāle)

atikālena

(?) very early; too early (see kālena)

atikāḷa

mf(~ī)n. too dark (see kāḷa)

atikāḷikā

(m)f(n). too dark (see kāḷaka)

atikisa

mfn. too thin (see kisa)

atikkanta

pp mfn. (act.)

  1. having passed through or by; having gone beyond, overcome, surpassed; having elapsed.
  2. who has approached (see atikkamati)
atikkanta-mānussaka

mf(-ikā)n. superhuman (see atikkanta)

atikkanta-vara

mfn. beyond or above granting boons (see atikkanta)

atikamma

absol. passing; passing through; surpassing; having gone beyond, beyond; beyond the norm; passing by, neglecting; transgressing; passing beyond, escaping, overcoming; (with expressions of time) after (see atikkamati)

atikkama

masculine going over or further; passing, passing beyond; overcoming.

atikkamaka

masculine going over.

pr. 3 sg.

  1. passes, passes through, passes by; elapses, passes (of time); steps over; goes beyond; surpasses; overcomes.
  2. goes beyond, crosses; escapes from.
  3. oversteps; transgresses (against), passes by, neglects; commits adultery (with).

atīta

pp mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.)
    1. past, gone by; former, belonging to past times.
    2. having neglected; transgressing.
    3. having passed beyond, overcome, escaped from (see acceti).
  2. (n.) what is past; the past; (a story of) the past.

acc. in the past (see atīta)

masculine the past (see atīta)

atītasmim

atīraka

mfn. unlimited.

atīva

(?) very much, exceedingly (see ati-)

atīsaraṃdiṭṭhi

feminine excessive view(s); deviant view(s).

ato

ind. from there; from this; than this; therefore.

atta1

masculine

  1. the self, the soul, as a permanent, unchangeable, autonomous entity (always rejected by the Pāḷi Buddhist texts as not corresponding to any reality).
  2. the self, one’s own self (the abstract individual); the image in a looking-glass; especially.
  3. oneself, himself, yourself, (used [in the sg.] as reflexive pronoun for all three persons and genders); instr. attanā, by oneself; in oneself, as for oneself, often used in the sense of a nom. (see also atta[n])
atta2

mfn. full, complete (or personal)

attakāma

mfn.

  1. (mfn.) (sometimes confused with atthakāma) wishing one’s own (spiritual) benefit.
  2. (m.) one’s own desire, lust; the saṅghādisesa offences of (praising the ministering to one’s) lust (see atta)
attakāra

masculine neuter action by oneself; a personal service (see atta)

attakilamatha

masculine self-mortification.

attagarahi(n)

mfn. blaming oneself; reproaching oneself (see atta)

attaghañña

neuter ~a, feminine self-destruction (see atta)

attacatuttha

mfn. with oneself as the fourth; with three others (see atta)

attaja

mfn. & m. feminine born from oneself proceeding from oneself; one’s offspring.

attaññu

mfn. knowing oneself (see atta)

attaṭhapañña

mfn. wise only for oneself; concerned with oneself only (so sometimes commentaries); (same as atta)

attatta

masculine one’s own profit or interest; one’s own goal (see atta)

attaṭṭapañña

mfn. looking (only) after one’s own profit or interest; (who is) wise as to his own advantage (see attatta)

attatthiya

mfn. concerned with one’s own goal (see atta)

atta-d-attha

m.a one’s own profit or interest; one’s own goal (see atta)

attadīpa

mfn. relying on oneself; with oneself as an island, a refuge.

attadutiya

mfn. with oneself as the second; with a companion (see atta)

attadhipaka

mfn. with the self, with oneself as master; controlled by the self (see atta)

attadhīna

mfn. dependent upon oneself (only); independent (see atta)

atta-n-tapa

mfn. self-mortifying; hurting oneself (see atta)

atta(n)

masculine (see atta)

attanīya

mfn. & neuter belonging to one ‘s self one’s own; belonging to an (enduring) self or soul; what belongs to one’s self; what belongs to an (enduring) self or soul.

attanudiṭṭhi

feminine dogma about the self; belief in an (enduring) self or soul (see atta)

attanupkkhi(n)

mfn. watching oneself (see atta)

attanuyogi(n)

mfn. intent upon oneself or one’s own interest (see atta)

attanuvādabhaya

neuter fear of self-reproach (see atta)

attapaṭilābha

masculine acquisition of a self; type of personal existence (see atta)

attabhara

mfn. supporting only oneself (see atta)

attabhāva

masculine bodily form, body; existence as an individual; living being (see atta)

attabhāvapaṭilābha

masculine the becoming reborn as an individual; reincarnation; type of body or existence (see attabhāva)

attabhāvi(n)

masculine having a body (see atta)

attamana

mfn. pleased; content; willing.

attamāraṇiya

mfn. causing death to oneself (see atta)

attarūpa1

mfn. very complete; (or quite personal) (see atta)

attarūpa2

mfn. or neuter fitting for oneself; just oneself; ~ena, ~ehi, by oneself, for one’s own sake (see atta)

attavādupādāna

neuter grasping the theory of an (enduring) self or soul (see atta)

attavetanabhata

mfn. supported by one’s own earnings (see atta)

attavyābādha

mfn. one’s own distress (see atta)

attahetu

ind. for one’s own sake (see atta)

attādāna

neuter taking upon oneself; a legal process (of the saṅgha) initiated by oneself (see atta)

attādhipateyya

neuter controlled by oneself (see atta)

attānam

acc. is used with fpp as if nom. n. (see atta)

attukkaṃsaka

mfn. praising or exalting oneself (see atta)

attukkaṃsana

neuter ~ā, feminine self-praise (see atta)

attuddesa

mfn. intended for oneself (see atta)

attuddesika

mfn. intended for oneself (see atta)

attūpanāyika

mfn. concerning oneself, applied to oneself, referring to oneself (see atta)

attha1

m rarely neuter

  1. aim, purpose, goal; advantage, profit, benefit.
  2. use, need, want (+ instr.).
    1. affair, concern, business; problem; thing, matter; (with verbs of saying, asking, etc. often simply) this, that.
    2. practical affairs, policy;
    3. a legal case.
  4. meaning, sense; very often in commentaries at end of explained (esp. paraphrased) passages as ti attho: this is the meaning; in association with dhamma, attha expresses the goal as opposed to the doctrine; practical affairs as opposed to spiritual matters; the practical application and result as opposed to the theory; the interpretation as opposed to the text.
attha2

masculine neuter

  1. sets (of the sun or moon)
  2. goes out, disappears, is extinguished.
atthaṃ

acc. for the sake of; for the purpose of (see attha)

atthaṃ anubhavati

(?) serves the interest, the purpose (of, gen.); benefits (see anubhavati)

atthaṃ anubhoti

(?) serves the interest, the purpose (of, gen.); benefits (see anubhoti)

atthakathā

feminine profitable talk, talk of the goal (see attha)

atthakaraṇa

neuter (the place for) dealing with lawsuits; seat of judgment, courtroom (see attha)

atthakavi

neuter a didactic poet (see attha)

atthakāma

mfn.

  1. wishing the benefit, profit (of, gen.); wishing (one) well.
  2. desiring the goal (see attha)
atthakāmi(n)

mfn. wishing one well (see attha)

atthakkhāyi(n)

mfn. declaring the goal or what is beneficial (see attha)

atthagata

mfn.

  1. set (of the sun).
  2. disappeared; destroyed.
atthagama

masculine annihilation, disappearance.

atthacara

mfn. who is helpful, who does good, brings benefit; who serves (see attha)

atthacaraka

mf(-ikā)n. (see atthacara)

atthacariyā

feminine conduct bringing benefit, helpful conduct; esp. benevolent behavior, helpful advice (see attha)

atthajāta

mfn. & neuter having some need or task (see attha)

atthaññū

mfn.ū knowing the means; knowing the goal; knowing the meaning (see attha)

atthata

pp mfn. covered; (of the kaṭhina) properly covered; (of the kaṭhina robe-making and ritual) properly carried out, properly performed (see attharati)

atthaṭakaṭhina

mfn. who has participated in the kaṭhina robe-making (and is therefore eligible for the five concessions) (see atthaṭa)

atthadassi(n)

mfn. seeing the goal or what is beneficial (see attha)

atthanusiṭṭhi

feminine administration of practical affairs or policy (see attha)

atthantara

mfn. taking the goal or meaning to heart; intent on the goal or meaning (see attha)

atthapaṭisambhidā

f.; ~a neuter analysis of the meaning (see attha)

atthapada

neuter profitable saying; word of good sense (see attha)

atthapucchana

neuter questioning about the aim (see attha)

atthapurekkhāra

mfn. aiming at the meaning, or at the benefit (see attha)

atthabaddha

mfn. bound to (one) for the meaning (see attha)

attharaṇa

neuter a covering, carpet; laying out.

attharati

pr. 3 sg. spreads out, spreads; spreads over, covers; lays out; esp. kaṭhinam attharati, covers the kaṭhina, participates in the kaṭhina robe-making and ritual.

attharitabba

fpp mfn. (see attharati)

attharitvā

absol. (see attharati)

atthava(t)

mfn.

  1. profitable; significant.
  2. possessing the goal; or possessing worldly knowledge (see attha)
atthavasa

masculine reason; motive (see attha)

atthavasi(n)

mfn. pursuing an aim (see attha)

atthavasika

mfn. pursuing an aim; pursuing the goal (see attha)

atthavādi(n)

mfn. speaking about the goal or what is beneficial (see attha)

atthaveda

mfn. knowledge or joy in the goal, or the practice (see attha)

atthasaṃhita

mfn. connected with the goal; useful, profitable; having meaning (see attha)

atthāya

dat. for the benefit of; for the sake of (gen.) (see attha)

atthāra

masculine spreading, covering (the kaṭhina); performing the kaṭhina robe-making and ritual; displaying the kaṭhina robe.

atthāraka

m(fn). (one) who covers (the kaṭhina); who supervises the communal robe-making and ritual.

atthi(n)

pr. 3 sg.

  1. is exists; is found.
  2. is of, belongs to (gen.).
  3. as auxiliary verb with pp.
  4. atthi is frequently used (usually at the beginning of a clause), with sg. or pi. subject (even with 1 sg. or 2sg.), to mean: there is, there are; there exists; or with a following verb [so also santiy to mean: there is [exists]… who…; it is the case that….
atthika1

mfn. desiring, wanting (instr.); aiming at, having as purpose (instr.); in need (of, instr.).

atthika2

mfn. who believes in the existence (of merit, another world, etc).

atthikava(t)

mfn. wanting something; having a purpose (see atthika)

atthikavāda

masculine & mfn.

  1. (m.) the doctrine that (merit, another world, etc) exists.
  2. (mfn.) following, professing that doctrine (see atthika)
atthitā

feminine existence; being; reality.

atthi(n)

mfn. (mfn., sg. nom. m. ~i) desirous; wanting something; having an aim.

atthiya

mfn. having a purpose or goal; useful, proper, fit.

atthisukha

neuter delighting in possessing something, in the existence of something.

atthu

3 sg. (see atthi)

atthūpaparikkhi(n)

mfn. investigating the meaning; inquiring into the significance (see attha)

atthopasaṃhita

mfn. connected with the goal, or with what is beneficial (see attha)

atthūpeta

mfn.

  1. expert in the meaning.
  2. meaningful connected with the goal or the meaning (see attha)
atra

ind. here; in this; in this respect, in this case.

atraja

mfn. & m. feminine (mfn.) born from oneself, one’s own; (m.) a son; (f.) a daughter.

atha

ind.

  1. and, and further.
  2. and (before that); and then.
  3. the, just then; next; with interrogatives.
  4. but (see also atho)
atha ko

(?)

  1. moreover.
  2. then; just then.
  3. but rather; but moreover; but also.
atha ca pana

(?) and yet; on the other hand (see atha)

athaparaṃ

(?) and further (see atha)

athabbaṇa

masculine or neuter (what belongs to) the Atharva-veda; a spell or a charm from the Atharva-veda (see also āthabbaṇa, āthabbana and athabbana)

athabbana

masculine or neuter (what belongs to) the Atharva-veda; a spell or a charm from the Atharva-veda (see also āthabbaṇa, āthabbana and athabbana)

atha vā

(?) or; or rather, or perhaps (in commentaries, introducing an alternative [preferred?] explanation) (see atha)

atha vā pi

(?) or also; and also (see atha)

atho

ind. and also; likewise; and yet, even then.

ada

mfn. eating; who eats.

adaṃsu

aor. 3 plural (see dadāti)

adaka

mfn. eating; who eats.

adasaka

mfn. without a fringe.

adurāgata

neg. mfn. not unwelcome; welcome (see durāgata)

addavalepana

mfn. newly plastered.

addita

pp mfn. distressed, pained, tormented.

addiyati

pr. 3 sg. is afflicted, distressed.

addha[n]

masculine

  1. a path, road; a journey.
  2. time.
addhagata

mfn. old (see addha[n])

addhagū

mfn. & masculine going on the road, walking, travelling; a traveler, a wayfarer.

addhanīya

mfn.

  1. fit for traveling.
  2. lasting a long period; enduring.
addhabhavi

aor. 3 sg. governed; controlled.

addhabhaveti

caus. pr. 3 sg. makes govern, lets control.

addhabhūta

aor. 3 sg. governed, mastered; dependent.

addhariya

masculine a sacrificing priest; name of a class of brahmans.

addhā

ind. certainly, for sure; truly; surely.

addhāṃ

ind. (?) (?) (see addhā)

addhāna

neuter path, road; journey; time.

addhānakkhama

mfn. enduring a long journey (see addhāna)

addhānamagga

masculine a road for journeying, a high road (see addhāna)

addhābhavanta

part. pr. mfn. master of; governing; controlling.

addhāyu

neuter duration of life (see addha[n])

addhāhina

mfn. being under-age, too young (see addhāna)

addhika

m(fn.) traveler; a wanderer.

adhama

mfn. lowest, worst; most vile.

adharakaya

masculine the lower part of the body.

adhi

prep

  1. as prefix to nouns (adjectives, adverbs) expresses: superiority, abundance.
  2. as preverb to verbs and their derivatives expresses: up to, towards, into; over, above; in addition to.
  3. as separate preposition with loc, and in prepositional compounds expresses: in, in regard to; adhi sometimes alternates with ati or abhi.
adhika

mfn. exceeding, surpassing; superior, predominant; more; too much, in excess.

adhikaraṇa

neuter

  1. subject of discussion or attention; case, legal question; dispute (in the saṅgha, to be formally dealt with).
  2. cause.
adhikaraṇakārika

masculine one who causes disputes or lawsuits (see adhikaraṇa)

addhikaraṇavūpasamana

neuter id. the settling of a case or dispute (see addhikaraṇa)

adhikaraṇasamatha

masculine (a method) of settling a case or dispute (see adhikaraṇa)

adhikaraṇika

masculine disputatious.

adhikasatasahassa

neuter more than 100, 000 (see adhika)

adhikāra

masculine service, help; act of merit.

adhikuṭṭana

feminine a chopping block.

adhikusala

feminine of high merit.

adhicitte

adhiceta(s)

mfn. attentive.

adhicca

mfn. & ind.

  1. (mfn.) fortuitous, occurring by mere chance; rare.
  2. (ind.) fortuitously, without cause or reason; rarely; only.
adhiccāpattika

mfn. rarely, or occasionally offending (see adhicca)

adhiccasamuppanna

adhiccasamuppannika

adhijegucchaṃ

adhijegucche

ind. as regards what is detestable, as regards scrupulousness.

adhiṭṭhaha(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see adhiṭṭhahati)

adhiṭṭhahati

pr. 3 sg. stands upon, depends upon; mounts; stands over, supervises; controls; designates, takes (formal) possession of (robe, bowl etc); resolves on, fixes the mind on, undertakes; resolves, determines, produces (by supernatural power) (see also adhitiṭṭhati and adhiṭṭhāti)

part. pr. mfn. (see adhiṭṭhahati)

adhiṭṭhātuṃ

inf. (see also adhiṭṭhāti)

adhiṭṭhāna

neuter support, basis; standpoint; abode; determination, resolution; fixing the mind on; determining, controlling, producing (by supernatural power); taking (formal) possession of, designating.

adhiṭṭhāya

absol. (see adhiṭṭheti)

adhiṭṭhita

pp mfn.

  1. (mfn.)
    1. (pass.) supervised; resolved on, undertaken; brought under control; possessed, designated, formally taken possession of; used.
    2. (act.) standing upon, mounted upon; resolving on; fixing one’s mind on.
  2. (n.) supervising (see adhitiṭṭhati)
adhiṭṭheti

pr. 3 sg. stands upon, depends upon; mounts; stands over, supervises; controls; designates, takes (formal) possession of (robe, bowl etc); resolves on, fixes the mind on, undertakes; resolves, determines, produces (by supernatural power) (see also adhitiṭṭhati)

adhitiṭṭhati

pr. 3 sg.

  1. inclines to; believes, is sure of; is convinced.
  2. concentrates on; pervades (in thought or meditation); wills (magically), changes (by magic).
  3. enters the body.

neg. absol. (see ajjhosāya)

anajjhosita

neg. mfn. not grasping (see ajjhosita)

anañña

mfn.

  1. not other, the same, identical.
  2. not another; no more (see añña)

mfn. not being otherwise, as it really is; true (see aññathā)

anaññathā

ind. not otherwise, accurately, as it really is (see aññathā)

anaññathābhāvi(n)

mfn. not subject to change (see aññathābhāvi[n])

anaññaneyya

mfn.

  1. not to be led by someone else; not needing guidance from anyone else.
  2. whither one cannot be guided by others (see anañña)

mfn. free of debt; independent.

neuter not passing; not going beyond; not transgressing.

aniñjita

neg. mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) not purturbed.
  2. (n.) lack of disturbance, quite (see iñjita)
anibbisaṃ

ind. not settling, not resting; or not paying; without expiation.

anibbisa(t)

mfn. not settling, not resting; or not paying; without expiation.

anirāmagandha

mfn. not free from corruption, tainted (see nirāmagandha)

anila

masculine (& n.) air; wind.

aniḷaka

mfn. (of honey) pure (see also anelaka, anīlaka and aneḷaka)

anivatti(n)

mfn. not turning back; not to be turned back.

anissara

mfn.

  1. not being an owner or master; not empowered, powerless.
  2. without an owner or ruler; without a creator (see issara)
anissā

feminine lack of envy, freedom from jealousy (see issā)

anissāmanaka

mf(-ikā)n. (see issāmanaka)

anissuka

mfn. not jealous, not envious.

anissuki(n)

mfn. not jealous; free from envy (see issuki[n])

anīka

(m.)n. an army; troops.

anīkagga

neuter the front, van of an army (see anīka)

anīkaṭṭha

masculine a soldier, esp. a royal guard or bodyguard (see anīka)

anīkadassana

masculine a troop inspection, a review of soldiers (see anīka)

anīti

feminine freedom from calamity; health, safety (see īti)

anītika

mfn. free from calamity or distress.

anītiha

mfn. not received through tradition; not based on hearsay.

anīḷaka

mfn. (of honey) pure (see also anelaka, aniḷaka and aneḷaka)

anu-

ind.

  1. as prefix and preverb expresses: with, along; after, behind; subordinate to, inferior to; according to, in conformity with; severally one after the other; repeatedly
  2. as separate preposition:
    1. with acc. and in prepositional compounds, expresses: according to, in conformity with; severally, each by each.
    2. with loc. expresses: along, alongside
  3. as adverb.
anu-aya

masculine

  1. lineage, succession; what follows, (logical) connection, inference, consequence.
  2. successor, immediate follower (see also anvaya)
anu-āgata

mfn. (pass.) followed by; affected by (see also anvāgata)

anu-ānayati

pr. 3 sg. leads or brings after oneself; incurs (see also anvānayati)

anu-āviṭṭha

pp. mfn. (see also anvāviṭṭha) entered (by), possessed (by) (see anvāvisati)

anu-iti

pr. 3 sg.

  1. follows; goes along with.
  2. goes into, enters; goes through (see also anveti and anu-eti)
anu-eti

pr. 3 sg.

  1. follows; goes along with.
  2. goes into, enters; goes through (see also anveti and anu-iti)
anu-esati

pr. 3 sg. searches; looks for (see also anvesati)

anu-esanta

part. pr. mfn. (see anvesati)

anu-otthaṭa

mfn. covered all over.

anukantati

pr. 3 sg. cuts.

anukampaka

mf(~ā & -ikā)n. kind, caring, compassionate.

anukampa(t)

part. pr. mfn (see anukampati)

anukampata

anukampita

pp mfn. favored; pitied; treated with compassion (see anukampati)

anukampi(n)

mfn. compassionate; sympathizing with.

pr. 3 sg. does after; imitates, emulates; equals (gen. of person); follows.

anukaronti

anupādā

neg. absol. not taking as one’s own, not holding on to; without (material) support, without dependence (see also anupādāya)

anupādāna

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) without taking as one’s own, without holding on to; without (material) support, without fuel.
  2. (n.) not holding; on to; absence of support or fuel (see upādāna)
anupādāya

neg. absol. not taking as one ‘s own, not holding on to, not grasping; without support, without dependence (see anupādāya)

anupādiṇṇa

neg. mfn. (also anupādinna) not evolved or derived, primary; not evolved by the influence of kamma; inanimate (see upadiṇṇa)

anupādinna

neg. mfn. (also anupādiṇṇa) not evolved or derived, primary; not evolved by the influence of kamma; inanimate (see upādinna)

anupādiya(t)

neg. mfn. (see upādiya[t])

anupādiyamāna

neg. mfn. (see upādiyamāna)

anupādisesa

mfn.

  1. (of nibbāna, at death) without any remnant of material support (the result of previous kamma), absolute.
  2. (of arhats) without any remnant of material support.
  3. without any trace or infection remaining; without leaving; any trace or infection (see upādisesa)

pr. 3 sg. reaches, attains; falls to one’s lot.

absol. (see anupāpuṇāti)

anupāyāsa

mfn.

  1. trouble-free; not bringing annoyance.
  2. not irritated, at peace; free from trouble or annoyance (see upāyāsa)

anussarati2

pr. 3 sg. remembers, recollects, calls to mind; reflects upon.

anussaranta

part. pr. mf(~antī)n. (see anussarati)

anussaramāna

part. pr. mfn. (see anussarati)

anussaritabba

fpp mfn. will remember; will recollect.

anussarita(r)

m.r one who remembers or recollects.

anussava

masculine what has been heard or repeated; hearsay; tradition.

anussavati

pr. 3 sg. flows in; flows upon (see also anusavati)

anussavappasanna

mfn. who believes from hearsay or report (see anussava)

anussavasacca

mfn. depending on tradition for one’s truths; accepting tradition as true (see anussava)

anussādetvā

absol. neg. (see ussādeti)

anussāvaka

masculine one who proclaims (the kammavācā); one who presents for upasampadā.

anussāvana

neuter -ā, feminine

  1. causing to be heard, sounding; proclamation (esp. of a kammavācā).
  2. canvassing, speaking repeatedly (in order to win support) (see also anusāvana)
anussāvayati

pr. 3 sg. causes to be heard; speaks out; proclaims (esp. a kammavācā); presents (someone) for upasampadā; speaks repeatedly (in order to win support) (see also anussāveti and anusāveti)

anussāvita

pp mfn. announced; proclaimed (see anussāveti)

anussāviyamāna

part. pr. mfn. being proclaimed; being announced (see anussāveti)

anussāveti

pr. 3 sg. causes to be heard; speaks out; proclaims (esp. a kammavācā); presents (someone) for upasampadā; speaks repeatedly (in order to win support) (see also anusāveti and anussāvayati)

anussāvesi

aor 3 sg. (see anussāveti)

anussāvesuṃ

3 plural (see anussāveti)

anussāha

masculine want of exertion or determination (see ussāha)

anussita

mfn. not exalted, humble (see ussita)

anussuka

mfn. not busy, quiet, unconcerned (see ussuka)

anussuta

pp. free from lust or defilement.

anuhīramāna

mfn. being held over.

anūdaka

mfn. (also anudaka and anodaka) without water (see udaka)

anūna

mfn. not less; not deficient; complete; full (see ūna)

anūnaka

mfn. not deficient, complete; having no lack (of, instr.) (see ūnaka)

anūpakhajja

absol. (see also anupakhajja)

anūpadhīka

mfn. free from attachment; free from acquisitions (which lead to rebirth) (see also anūpadhīka)

anūpanāhi(n)

mfn. (also anupanāhi[n]) not resentful; without rancor (see upanāhi[n]).

anūpanīta

neg. mfn. (see also anupanīta) (see upanīta)

anūpama

mfn. (also anupama & anopama) incomparable, peerless; excellent, best (see upamā)

anūpaya

mfn. (also anupaya) not going near (to); free from involvement (see upaya)

anūpalitta

neg. mfn. (see also anupalitta) not attached to; not sticking to (see upalitta)

anūpavajja

neg. mfn. (also anupavajja) (see upavajja)

anūpavāda

masculine (see also anupavāda) lack of abuse; not blaming or criticizing (see upavāda)

anūpahata

neg. mfn. (also anupahata) (see upahata)

anūsara

mfn. not having saline soil (see ūsara)

anūhata

mfn. not removed; not extracted, not rooted out.

aneka

mfn. not one, i.e. many, various; of various kinds; countless, numberless (see eka)

anekaṃsika

neg. mfn. (see ekaṃsika)

anekaṃsikata

mfn. not decided; not determined; not absolute.

anekapariyāyena

adv. in many ways; in a manifold way; with several parallel expressions (see aneka)

anekabhāga

mfn. multiplied; manifold (see aneka)

anekarūpa

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) various, of various kinds, of many forms.
  2. (n.) manifold form; various ways (see aneka)
anekavassagaṇika

mfn. in existence for many years (see aneka)

anekavidha

mfn. of several kinds; manifold; various (see aneka)

anekavihita

mfn. varioulsy ordered; of several kinds, various (see aneka)

anekasata

mfn. consisting of many hundreds (see aneka)

anekasahassa

mfn. consisting of many thousands (see aneka)

anekasārīrika

(m)f(n). relating to more than one body, connected with many bodies (see aneka)

aneja

mfn.

  1. (mfn.) unmoved, imperturbable; without emotion.
  2. (n.) imperturbability; immoveable state; freedom from emotion (see ejā)
aneñja

neuter (& mfn.?)

  1. (n.) immovability; imperturbability.
  2. (mfn., or n. in apposition?) unmoved; not to be stirred; imperturbable (often applied both to determinative actions leading to existence in arūpāvacara spheres, and to arūpa jhāna stages) (see also āneñja)

mfn. (of honey) pure (see also anīlaka, aniḷaka and aneḷaka)

mfn. (faultless (of speech, of voice) (see also aneḷagala and aneḷagaḷa)

anelamūga

mfn. not foolish, wise (see elamūga)

mfn. (of honey) pure (see also anīlaka, aniḷaka and anelaka)

aneḷagaḷa

aneḷamūga

mfn. not foolish, wise (see eḷamūga)

  2. (n.) homelessness; independence (see oka)

anodhijina

mfn. (also anūpama & anupama) incomparable, peerless; excellent, best (see upamā)

anopārambha

anta2

anta3

neuter (sg. & pl.) the bowels, intestines.

antaka

m(fn.) “making an end”, a designation of the god of death, identified with Mārā.

antakara

antamaso

ind. eve; even so much as.

antara

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) interior; inner, inward.
  2. (n.)
    1. interior part, inside; heart, mind; place between; interval (of time or space); moment between (two events); distance; difference, disagreement.
    2. inner meaning, real state of the case
  3. concentrates on, keeps in mind.
antaraṃ karoti

(?) concentrates on; keeps in mind (see antara)

antarakappa

masculine ( & n.) a subdivision or intermediate cycle of a mahākappa (see antara)

antaragharaṃ

ind. between the houses, among the houses (i.e. in the village); within a house (see antara)

antaraghare

ind. within a house; (se antara)

antarato

ind. from within, inwardly (see antara)

antarā

adv. & prep.

  1. (adv.) inside; on the way, in the meantime; beforehand, before (reaching something).
  2. (prep.) between (gen. or acc).

ind. in the middle; as an interruption (see antarā)

anto

adv. & prep.

  1. (adv.) within, inside.
  2. (prep.)
    1. + loc. (sometimes written as cpd): within, inside, in the middle (of)
    2. + acc. (sometimes written as cpd): within, inside.

pp mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) gone, gone away (from); departed.
  2. (n.) error; transgression.

apagabbha

mfn. interpreted by the Buddha as apa + gabbha, describing one who has destroyed the possibility of rebirth) timid, lacking boldness; ? of low birth?.

apajaha

mfn. not giving up; grasping, greedy (?).

apajita

apālamba

masculine a restraining rail on a carriage.

api

ind.

  1. even, also; even though, although;
    1. prothetic (at the beginning of a sentence or clause)
    2. enclitic
  2. but, and (at the beginning of a clause)
  3. as interrogative particle (usually at the beginning of a sentence or clause)
  4. as emphasis to optative: perhaps, maybe; please may…; if only; I wish that…
  5. indeed, surely; yes (at the beginning of a sentence).
api ca

(?) and yet, nevertheless; but, however; moreover (see api)

api ce

(?) even if (see api)

api nu

interrogative particle (see api)

api nu kho

interrogative particle (see api)

api nūna

interrogative particle (see api)

api ssu

(?) and further, moreover (see api)

api ssudaṃ

(?) and further, moreover (see api)

api hi

(?) although (see api)

neuter rubbing with oil, smearing, oiling, lubricating; unguent, oil.

abbhañjiṃsu

3 plural (see abbhañjati)

abbhañjitvā

absol. (see abbhañjati)

mfn. excessive; very great.

mfn.

  1. (pass.) overstepped, transgressed; neglected; passed (by).
  2. (act.)
    1. having elapsed; passed away.
    2. past; dead.

ind. towards home, towards setting.

(?) disappears, comes to an end (see abbhatthaṃ)

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) interior, internal; being within, included in, among; belonging to one ‘s house, personal, intimate.
  2. (n.)
    1. intermediate space, interval; the inside, interior.
    2. a measure of length (= 28 hatthas).

mfn. resting inside, in the heart (see abbantara)

abbhantarika

mfn. intimate; trusted.

abbhantarima

mfn. being far within; inner, innermost; very intimate.

abbhuta

mfn. neuter

  2. (n.) a wonderful thing, a marvel.
abbhutaṃ

(?) is used often as an exclamation (frequently combined with acchariyam): how wonderful! what an astonishing thing! (see abbhuta)

amba2

masculine & neuter

  1. (m.) the mango tree.
  2. (n. & m.) the mango fruit.

ambilagga

ambu

ambuja

masculine a fish (see ambu)

ambho

ind. exclamatory particle used, often with following voc, to attract attention or to address vigorously; sometimes expressing reproach or anger or objection: ho ! hey ! look here ! I say!

ammā

feminine a mother; sg. voc. (a term of familiar address used to females, esp. to a mother)

ayopatta

masculine (also ayapatta) an iron bowl (see aya[s])

ayosiṅghātaka

neuter (also ayasiṅghātaka) an iron bowl (see aya[s])

ayya

m.f.

  1. (m.) a lord, master; a worthy person; the venerable sir, if.) a mistress; a noble lady; the venerable lady.
  2. (mfn.) well-born; worthy, venerable.
ayyaka

masculine

  1. a grandfather; an ancestor.
  2. a master (see also ayyika)
ayyakā

feminine a grandmother (see also ayyikā)

ayyaputta

masculine a young master, the son of the house; a (young) lord; a husband (see ayya)

ayyaputtaka

masculine a young lord, a husband (see ayya)

ayyavosāṭitaka

(mf)n. (food) offered to the ancestors (see ayya)

ayyika

masculine

  1. a grandfather; an ancestor.
  2. a master (see also ayyaka)
ayyikā

feminine a grandmother (see also ayyakā)

ara

masculine the spoke of a wheel.

arañña

neuter wilderness; forest, jungle; the wild.

araññavihāra

masculine (the ascetic) life in the wild; a dwelling in the wild (see arañña)

araññāyatana

neuter a place in the forest, a forest haunt (see arañña)

araṇika

masculine or neuter one of the tools for kindling fire.

araṇisahita

neuter the fire implements, the kindling stick.

araha

mfn. deserving, worthy (of); proper, fit (to).

arahaggata

mfn. directed towards arahats; (or directed towards the worthy) (see araha[t])

araha(t)1

masculine (& f.?) ‘a worthy one’, an arahat; (in Buddhism) one who has realized nibbāna; one in whom the āsavas are destroyed and who is no longer liable to rebirth.

araha(t)2

part. pr. mfn. (see arahati)

arahati

pr. 3 sg. is worthy of, deserves; is entitled to; is fit to; ought to; should, must (+ inf.).

arahatta

neuter abstr. the state or condition of an arahat; arahatship (see araha[t])

arahattaphala

neuter the fruit, the fulfillment of arahatship (i.e. nibbāna) (see arahatta)

arahattamagga

masculine the path of arahatship, the progress towards arahatship (see arahatta)

arahaddhaja

masculine the emblem of the arahat (the yellow robe) (see araha[t])

arahantaghātaka

masculine the killer of an arahat (see araha[t])

arahantavāda

masculine the title of an arahat (see araha[t])

arājaka

mfn. without a king (see also arājika).

arājika

mfn. without a king (see also arājaka).

ariṭṭha

masculine neuter a kind of decoction or liquor.

ariṭṭhaka

masculine & mfn.

  1. (m.) (the fruit of) the soap-berry tree.
  2. (mfn.) black (like the fruit of the soap-berry tree).
aritta

neuter a pole used as a punting pole or rudder.

ariya

mfn. m. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) belonging to the Ariya people.
  2. (mfn. & m.) noble, sublime, fine; belonging to the noble ones (used esp. of the Buddha’s teaching and followers, almost = ‘Buddhist’); a noble one (one who is not puthujjana).
ariyaka

neuter & mfn.

  1. (n.) the Ariya language.
  2. (mfn.) who is an Ariya, who speaks the Ariya language.
ariyagarahi(n)

mfn. reproaching, censuring the noble ones (see ariya)

ariyaddasa

mfn. seeing what belongs to the noble ones, what is noble (see ariya)

ariyamagga

masculine a path of the noble ones; the noble path (often – the eightfold path); the noble course (of sotāpatti etc) (see ariya)

ariyavaṃsa

m.(n.) a tradition of the noble ones; a noble lineage or tradition (see ariya)

ariyavaṃiksa

mfn. practicing the traditions of the noble ones, belonging to the noble tradition; who recites the Ariyavaṃsa-sutta (see ariya)

ariyavāsa

masculine a way of living of the noble ones; a sublime state (see ariya)

ariyavihāra

masculine a mode of life of the noble ones; a sublime state (see ariya)

ariyavutti

mfn. noble in conduct (see ariya)

ariyavohāra

masculine the way of speaking of the noble ones; a noble mode of speech (see ariya)

ariyasacca

neuter a truth of the noble ones; a sublime truth (see ariya)

ariyasīli(n)

mfn. having the (moral) nature of a noble one, of sublime practice (see ariya)

ariyāyatana

neuter the region of the Ariyas (see ariya)

ariyūpavādi(n)

mfn. speaking ill of the noble ones, insulting the noble ones (see ariya)

aruka

masculine a sore.

arukāya

masculine a mass of sores.

arugatta

mfn. with sores on all limbs.

aruṇa

m.n. the dawn; first light.

aruṇaṃ uṭṭhāpeti

(?) lets the dawn arise, appear (while doing something); (carries on doing something) until dawn (see uṭṭhāpeti)

aruṇagga

neuter the first break of day; dawn; (also written as aruṇugga)

aruṇugga

neuter the first break of day; dawn (see also aruṇagga)

aruṇuggamana

neuter dawn; sunrise.

arūpamacitta

masculine whose thoughts are like a (tender) sore.

arogāpeti

mfn.a cures, makes well.

arosaneyya

mfn. not to be angered, not irritable.

ala

masculine

  1. the claw of a crab.
  2. a (scorpion’s) tail (see also aḷa)
alacchinna

mfn. with thumbs and/or big toes mutilated.

aḷa

masculine

  1. the claw of a crab.
  2. a (scorpion’s) tail (see also ala)
alaṃ

ind.

  1. enough, sufficient; adequate, equal to; competent, able; suitable, fit for (+ gen./dat. personae; + dat. rei or inf.; or as predicate to subject in nom.).
  2. enough of, no more of away with; there is no need of (+ instr. rei or inf.).
  3. (absolutely): enough! stop! don’t!
alaṃvacanīya

mfn. (formally) repudiated; separated, estranged (see alaṃ)

alaṃsamakkhāta(r)

masculine a competent teacher (see alaṃ)

alaṃsākaccha

mfn. fit to speak in a discussion (see alaṃ)

alaṃsājīva

mfn. fit for the communal life (see alaṃ)

alagadda

masculine (& mfn.) (m.) a water-snake; (mfn.) like (the getting hold of) a water-snake:

alaṅkata

pp mfn. adorned, decorated; wearing ornaments (see alaṅkaroti)

alaṅkatapaṭiyatta

mfn. adorned and decorated; fully adorned (see alaṅkata)

alaṅkammanīya

mfn. suitable, adequate for the action (see alaṃ)

alaṅkaroti

pr. 3 sg. ornaments; adorns oneself; puts on; (neg.) finds no satisfaction in.

alaṅkāra

masculine ornament, decoration; the act of decorating; improvement.

alattakakata

masculine reddened (with lac).

alamatta

mfn. competent (see alaṃ)

alamattha

mfn. able; competent (see alaṃ)

alamatthatara

mfn. (compar.) more competent.

alamatthadasatara

mfn. (compar.) more competent to see what is beneficial; wiser (see alaṃ)

alamatthavicintaka

mfn. able to discern the goal or what is beneficial (see alaṃ)

alamariya

mfn. suitable for or worth of the noble ones; truly noble (see alaṃ)

alampañña

mfn. capable of reason, sensible (see alaṃ)

alampateyyā

(m)f(n). suitable, fit for marriage (see alaṃ)

alasa

mf(n). lazy, inactive; indolent, idle.

alasaka

masculine flatulence.

alasajātīka

mf(n). lazy by nature; disposed to laziness (see alasa)

alāta

neuter a firebrand; fire.

alāpu

neuter (the fruit of) the bottle-gourd.

alābu

alābulomasa

mfn. hairy like a gourd (see alābu)

alābhaka

masculine (or n.) the not getting (something); the not receiving anything.

alika

mfn. & neuter untrue; false; a lie, a falsehood.

alla

mfn. wet, moist; fresh.

allika

masculine or ~ā feminine the dye made from the leaves of the alli plant.

alliyati

pr. 3 sg. comes close to; settles down on; leans against; sticks to, is attached (to, acc. or loc) (see also allīyati)

allīna

pp mfn. sticking to, attached to; come close to; resorting to (see allīyati)

allīyati

pr. 3 sg. comes close to; settles down on; leans against; sticks to, is attached (to, acc. or loc) (see also alliyati)

avaṃ

ind. downwards.

avaṃsira

pr. 3 sg. removes; draws away; secedes.

mfn. with the face downward, prone; upset.

avakkanti

avakkāra

avakkārapāti

avagamaka

ahaṃ

ahaṇkāra

masculine

  1. the (false) conception of one’s individuality; pride, conceit.
  2. the theory of self-creation (see ahaṃ)
ahaṇkārapasuta

mfn. devoted to the theory of self-creation (see ahaṇkāra)

ahaha

masculine the name of a hell, or place in Avīci, where one suffers for an ahaha of years.

ahi

masculine a snake.

ahicchattaka

masculine neuter a mushroom (see ahi)

ahimekhalikā

feminine a snake-girdle (see ahi)

ahirika

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) shameless.
  2. (n.) shamelessness (see also ahirīka)
ahirīka

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) shameless.
  2. (n.) shamelessness (see also ahirika)
ahivātakaroga

masculine a certain dangerous contagious disease (see ahi)

ahivijjā

feminine serpent-lore (see ahi)

ahetuka

mfn. without a cause.

ahetukavāda

mfn. holding a theory of non-causality (see ahetuka)

aho

ind. an exclamation oh!, expressing;

  1. a wish or a hope; oh that… !, would that … !.
  2. astonishment or joy; admiration (sometimes ironic): oh! oh indeed!
  3. dismay, painful surprise; compassion, regret: oh! alas!.
  4. blame, reproach.
  5. a summons: hey!
ahoratta

masculine a day and night.

ahorattaṃ

acc. adv. day and night; continually (see ahoratta)

ahorattanusikkhi(n)

mfn. continually studying; learning (see ahoratta)

ahoratti

feminine a day and a night.

ākaṅkha(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see ākaṅkhati)

ākaṅkhati

pr. 3 sg. wishes; desires, longs for; wants to, is willing (to); intends.

ākaṅkhanta

part. pr. mfn. (see ākaṅkhati)

ākaṅkhamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see ākaṅkhati)

ākaṅkhiṃ

1 sg. (see ākaṅkhati)

ākaṅkhita

pp mfn. wished for; desired (see ākaṅkhati)

ākaṅkhiya

fpp mfn. (see ākaṅkhati)

ākaḍḍhati

pr. 3 sg. drags, pulls; pulls near, draws (towards oneself), attracts; supplies (an omitted, understood word); draws out, brings about; bends (a bow); draws (a line), scratches.

ākaḍḍhana

neuter ~ā, feminine (from ākaḍḍhati) dragging to, drawing towards; pulling, pulling about; drawing out; bending (a bow).

ākaḍḍhanta

part. pr. mfn. (see ākaḍḍhati)

ākaḍḍhitva

absol. (see ākaḍḍhati)

ākaḍḍhiyamāna

part. pr. mfn. dragging, pulling; pulling near, drawing (towards oneself).

ākappa

masculine dress, appearance, guise; outward sign; deportment; (good) behavior.

ākappasampanna

mfn. of good deportment or appearance; decorous (see ākappa)

ākāra

masculine

  1. form, appearance; external characteristic, sign, gesture; expression; deceptive appearance, pretense.
  2. mode; sort; aspect; way, manner.
  3. cause, reason.
  4. dividing up, detailing; definition.
ākārava(t)

mfn. having a form; having a cause; grounded (see ākāra)

ākāsa

masculine neuter

  1. the ether; air, sky; space; open space.
  2. a game, playing in the air.
ākāsakasiṇa

neuter concentration on space, meditation based on space; the meditation object space (see ākāsa)

ākāsagata

mfn. (also ākāsaṅgata) in the air; belonging to the sky or space (see ākāsa)

ākāsaṅgata

mfn. (also ākāsagata) in the air; belonging to the sky or space (see ākāsa)

ākāsaṭṭha

mfn. living in the sky; being in the sky; being in the air (see ākāsa)

ākāsānañcāyatana

neuter the sphere or stage of the infinity of space, i.e.

  1. the first of the arūpa states of existence; and.
  2. the state of the consciousness of the infinity of space, the first arūpajhāna or one of the vimokkhas (see ākāsa)
ākiñcañña

neuter

  1. (n.)
    1. the state of having nothing; complete absence of possessions.
    2. the state of nothingness
  2. (mfn.) associated with nothingness or with having nothing.
ākiñcaññāyatana

neuter the sphere or stage of (the awareness of) nothingness, i.e.

  1. the third of the arūpa states of existence; and.
  2. the state of awareness of nothingness, the third arūpajhāna or one of the vimokkhas (see ākiñcañña)
ākiñcanasambhava

masculine the origin of the state of nothingness.

ākiṇṇa

pp mfn. poured (into), heaped up (in); overspread, filled, crowded; surrounded, being in a crowd; disordered, unrestrained, impure (see ākirati)

ākiṇṇakammanta

mfn. rough in action; acting impurely (see ākiṇṇa)

ākiṇṇamanussa

mfn. full of people; crowded with people (see ākiṇṇa)

ākiṇṇaludda

mfn. rough and fierce; very fierce (see ākiṇṇa)

ākiṇṇaloma

neuter matted, thick hair (see ākiṇṇa)

ākiṇṇavihāra

masculine living in crowds (see ākiṇṇa)

ākirati

pr. 3 sg. sprinkles, scatters over; pours (into, loc), heaps up (in); dispenses.

ākiranta

part. pr. mf(~antī)n. (see ākirati)

ākiritvā

absol. (see ākirati)

ākoṭayati

pr. 3 sg. beats, strikes; knocks (at); pounds; hammers (in) (see also ākoṭeti)

ākoṭāpeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. (see ākoṭeti)

ākoṭita

pp mfn. beaten; knocked (at); pounded; hammered (in) (see ākoṭeti)

ākoṭitapaccākoṭita

mfn. beaten and pounded; pounded this way and that (see ākoṭita)

ākoṭetabba

pp mfn. (see ākoṭeti)

ākoṭeti

pr. 3 sg. beats, strikes; knocks (at); pounds; hammers (in) (see also ākoṭayati)

ākoṭetvā

ākoṭesi

aor. 3 sg. (see ākoṭeti)

ākoṭesuṃ

3 plural (see ākoṭeti)

ākhīṇa

mfn. scattered, unrestrained; rough; impure.

ākhīṇavyappatha

mfn. of rough speech (ākhīṇa)

āga1

aor. 3 sg. (see āgā)

āga2

2 sg. (see āgā)

āgacchati

pr. 3 sg. comes, comes near; comes back, returns; reaches, attains; is recorded, is handed down by tradition.

āgacchana

neuter (from āgacchati) returing.

āgacchanta

āgañchi2

āgañchiṃsu

āgañchu(ṃ)

āgata

pp mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) come, arrived, come back; present; having reached, attained; come down, handed down, learnt.
  2. (n.) arrival; coming (see āgacchati)
āgatavisa

mfn. with quickly rising poison (see āgata)

āgatāgata

mfn. whenever he (she, it) comes; whoever comes (see āgata)

āgatāgama

mfn. who has mastered the tradition; learned (see āgata)

āgantabba

fpp mfn. to come.

āganta(r)

masculine one who comes, who returns; (as periphrastic future) will come, will return.

āgati

feminine arrival, coming; return, rebirth.

āgantuṃ

inf. (see āgacchati)

āgantuka

mfn. m. & ~ā, feminine

  1. (mfn.) added, accessory; incidental adventitious, external.
  2. (mfn. and m.f) arriving, coming; a newcomer, a stranger; a traveller, esp. a visiting bhikkhu or bhikkhum.
āgantvā

absol. coming; having come, reached; returning (see āgacchati)

āgama

masculine

  1. (m.)
    1. coming, approach; access; income, return.
    2. tradition, traditional learning; scriptures, canonical text; a nikāya
    .
  2. (mfn.) coming, approaching, next.
āgamaṃ

1 sg. (see āgacchati)

āgamaṃsu

āgamana

neuter coming, approach; return; progress; (iic also: approaching, future).

āgamanadiṭṭhika

āgamanīya

āghātana

  1. slaughter house; place of execution.
  2. death.
ācama

masculine (?) sipping; rinsing.

ācamakumbhī

feminine a rinsing vessel (holding water) (see ācama)

ācamati

pr. 3 sg. sips (water, for purification); rinses (one’s mouth or one’s body) (see also ācameti and ācamayati)

ācamana

neuter rinsing; sipping (water, for purification); washing.

ācamanakumbhī

feminine a rinsing vessel (holding water) (see ācamana)

ācamanapādukā

fpp mfn. to be taken; to be undertaken; to be used.

ādāta(r)

masculine one who takes, who receives.

ādātuṃ

inf. to grasp, to take; to seize.

ādāna

neuter (& m.) taking, grasping; holding on to; attachment.

ādānasatta

mfn. or masculine attached to grasping; or creature of attachment (see ādāna)

ādāya1

absol. taking, receiving, with.

ādāya2

masculine (the adopting of) a belief, a view.

ādāyagamanīya

mfn. [from ādāya gacchati, ‘he goes with, he takes ‘], to be gone with; to be taken; going with.

ādāsa

masculine a looking-glass; a mirror.

ādāsaka

masculine a mirror.

ādi

masculine beginning; starting point, cause.

ādikatta(r)

masculine the first performer, the originator (see ādi)

ādikammika

mf(n). who is the first to perform a particular action (see ādi)

ādikara

mf(n). who is the first to perform a particular action (see ādi)

ādibrahmacariya

neuter primary or fundamental morality; the higher holy life (see ādi)

ādibrahmacariyaṃ

adv. as regards a pure and holy life (see ādibrahmacariya)

ādibrahmacariyaka

adv. concerning (the fundamentals of) the pure and holy life; belonging to primary or fundamental morality; forming a cause or beginning of the holy life (see ādi)

ādikena

instr. adv. in the beginning; at once.

ādicca

masculine and mfn.

  1. (m.) the sun.
  2. (mfn.) belong to the ādicca lineage.
ādiccapatha

masculine the path of the sun; the sky (see ādicca)

ādiccabandhu

masculine kinsman of the sun; of the “sun” lineage (see ādicca)

ādiṇṇasipātika

mfn. with split or burst seed pods.

ādito

adv. (also ādiso) from the beginning; at first; at the beginning; as a beginning (see ādi)

āditta

pp mfn. blazing, burning; red-hot (see ādippati)

ādinna

pp mfn.

  1. taken, grasped; taken up, undertaken.
  2. used, employed (of the distinguishing mark on a robe).
ādinnadaṇḍa

mfn. who has taken a stick in hand; who administers justice; who has embraced violence (see ādinna)

ādippati

pr. 3 sg. blazing, burning; red-hot

ādiya(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see ādiyati)

ādiyati1

pr. 3 sg. takes, accepts, receives; takes up, undertakes; appropriates; seizes, grasps.

ādiyati2

pr. 3 sg. attends to, takes notice of; shows respect to (+ acc. or gen.).

ādiyanapaccayā

adv. because of the taking.

ādiyanta

part. pr. mf(~antī)n. (see ādiyati)

ādiyapeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. makes take; makes accept.

ādiyamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see ādiyati)

ādiyamukha

mfn. credulous; quickly convinced (see also ādheyyamukha)

ādiyi1

aor. 3 sg. (see ādiyati)

ādiyi2

aor. 3 sg. (see ādiyati)

ādiyituṃ

inf. to grasp, to take; to seize.

ādiyitvā

absol. taking, receiving, with.

ādisati

pr. 3 sg. aims at; points out, indicates; relates, declares, foretells; dedicates; assigns (one’s own puñña to someone else).

ādisanta

part. pr. mfn. (see ādisati)

ādiso

adv. (also ādito) from the beginning; at first; at the beginning; as a beginning (see ādi)

ādisitvā

absol. (see ādisati)

ādissa1

absol. aiming at; indicating; specifying; with reference to; assigning (see ādisati)

ādissa2

fpp mfn. to be pointed at; to be criticized (see ādisati)

ādīnava

masculine wretchedness; bad consequence, disadvantage, danger (in, loc. or gen.)

ādīnavadassa

mfn. seeing the danger (see ādīnava)

ādīnavadassāvi(n)

mfn. seeing the danger, realizing the bad consequences (see ādīnava)

ādīnavanupassi(n)

mfn. seeing the danger, realizing the bad consequences (see ādīnava)

ādu

ind. or; introducing a second question or the second part of a disjunctive question.

ādeti

pr. 3 sg. takes, accepts, receives; takes up, undertakes; appropriates; seizes, grasps.

ādeyyavākyavacana

mfn. whose speech is persuasive or influential.

ādeyyavācana

mfn. whose speech is persuasive or influential.

ādeva

masculine lamenting; deploring.

ādevanā

feminine lamenting; deploring.

ādevitatta

neuter abstr. wailing, lamenting, deploring.

ādesita

caus. pp mfn. shown; indicated (see ādisita)

ādesanāpāṭihāriya

neuter the miracle or marvelous power of indicating (another’s thoughts or state of mind).

ādesanavidhā

feminine a form or variety of indicating; (another’s thoughts or state of mind)

ādhātuṃ

inf. to place on; to fix, to settle; to establish; to accept, receive.

ādhāna

neuter depositing, placing; a container, a receptacle; establishing, kindling (afire).

ādhānagāhin
ādhāna(g)gāhi(n)

mfn. grasping, sticking to what has been laid down; ? obstinate.

ādhāya

absol. having placed on; having fixed, settled; having established; having accepted, received.

ādhāra

masculine a support, prop; a holder, stand; that which contains, a vessel, a receptacle; the subject of discussion.

ādhāvati

pr. 3 sg. runs, runs towards, runs about.

ādhāvitvā

absol. (see ādhāvati)

ādhipacca

neuter (from ādhipati) sovereignty, supremacy; power, control.

ādhipati

masculine lord, sovereign.

ādhipateyya

neuter & mfn.

  1. (n.) sovereignty, power; control, controlling influence.
  2. (mfn.) powerful, controlling, sovereign.
ādhenta

part. pr. mfn. placing on; fixing, settling; establishing, kindling; accepting, receiving; adding (fuel to fire).

ādheyya

fpp mfn. to be deposited or placed (in); being contained; to be assigned or entrusted; being the responsibility (of), being in the control (of).

ādheyyamukha

mfn. credulous; quickly convinced (see also ādiyamukha)

ānaṇya

neuter release or freedom from debt or obligation.

ānantarika1

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) immediately preceding or following, next; nearest.
  2. (mfn.) immediate; bringing immediate results; (of an action) producing consequences in the immediately following existence; (of a person) suffering immediate retribution, suffering consequences in the immediately following existence; (n.) an action producing consequences in the immediately following existence (see also ānantariya)
ānantarika2

neuter immediacy, immediate sequence or succession; the state bringing immediate results (see also ānantariya)

ānantarikakamma

neuter an action bringing retribution in the immediately following existence (see ānantarika)

ānantariya1

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) immediately preceding or following, next; nearest.
  2. (mfn.) immediate; bringing immediate results; (of an action) producing consequences in the immediately following existence; (of a person) suffering immediate retribution, suffering consequences in the immediately following existence; (n.) an action producing consequences in the immediately following existence (see also ānantarika)
ānantariya2

neuter immediacy, immediate sequence or succession; the state bringing immediate results (see also ānantarika)

ānupubbikathā

ānubhāva

masculine majesty, splendor; authority; power, efficacy; magic or supernatural power; instr. ~ena often expresses: by means of, owing to.

ānubhi

aor. 3 sg. (see also anubhavati)

ānulomika

mfn. in regular order; conformable to, suitable.

ānejja

neuter immovability; imperturbability.

ānejjakārana

neuter the feat of immovability (or a trained elephant) (see ānejja)

ānejja(p)patta

mfn. who or which has reached immovability or imperturbability (see ānejja)

āneñja

neuter (& mfn.?)

  1. (n.) immovability; imperturbability.
  2. (mfn., or n. in apposition?) unmoved; not to be stirred; imperturbable (often applied both to determinative actions leading to existence in arūpāvacara spheres, and to arūpa jhāna stages) (see also aneñja)
āneñjakāraṇa

neuter the feat of immovability (or a trained elephant) (see ānenja)

āneñja(p)patta

mfn. who or which has reached immovability or imperturbability (see ānenja)

āneñjabhisaṅkhāra

masculine neuter an accumulation of motive force, impetus, for arūpa states (see ānenja)

ārañjita

pp mfn. & neuter slashed or scored; a mark, a furrow.

ārañña

mfn. being in a forest, in the wild; forest-born, wild.

āraññaka

mfn. & masculine

  1. (mfn.) belonging to the forest or the wild; living in the wild; wild; who has undertaken the dhutaṅga of living in the wild.
  2. (m.) one who lives in the forest; a bhikkhu living in the wild, who has undertaken the dhutaṅga of living in the wild (see also āraññika)
āraññakaṅga

neuter the practice of living in the wild (one of the dhutaṅgas): (see āraññaka)

āraññika

mfn. & masculine

  1. (mfn.) belonging to the forest or the wild; living in the wild; wild; who has undertaken the dhutaṅga of living in the wild.
  2. (m.) one who lives in the forest; a bhikkhu living in the wild, who has undertaken the dhutaṅga of living in the wild (see also āraññaka)

neuter the practice of living in the wild (one of the dhutaṅgas): (see āraññaka)

ārati

feminine abstinence; keeping away from; aversion.

āraddha2

mfn. accomplished, achieved; pleased; satisfied.

āraddhā

pp having begun or started.

āvusavāda

masculine (also āvusovāda) the addressing as āvuso, the title āvuso (see āvuso)

āvuso

pr. 3 sg. used

  1. by and to non-Buddhists.
  2. by bhikkhus (and bhikkhunīs)
    1. to lay-followers.
    2. to each other (but not used by or to the Buddha, and later used only by a senior bhikkhu to a junior.
āvusovāda

masculine (also āvusavāda) the addressing as āvuso, the title āvuso (see āvuso)

āveṇi

adv. or mfn. separately, apart; or not united, separate (see also āveṇiṃ and āveni)

āveṇiṃ

adv. or mfn. separately, apart; or not united, separate (see also āveṇi and āveni)

āveṇika

mfn. not united, not mingled together (as is a plait of hair or the confluence of rivers); separate; specific, particular (see also āveṇiya, āvenika and āveniya)

āveṇibhāva

masculine separateness, distinction; schism (see āveṇi)

āveṇiya

mfn. not united, not mingled together (as is a plait of hair or the confluence of rivers); separate; specific, particular (see also āveṇika, āvenika and āveniya)

āveni

adv. or mfn. separately, apart; or not united, separate (see also āveṇi and āveṇiṃ)

āvenika

mfn. not united, not mingled together (as is a plait of hair or the confluence of rivers); separate; specific, particular (see also āveṇika, āveṇiya and āveniya)

āveniya

mfn. not united, not mingled together (as is a plait of hair or the confluence of rivers); separate; specific, particular (see also āveṇika, āveṇiya and āvenika)

feminine a garland worn on the head or ears, a chaplet.

āvesana

  1. a workshop.
  2. making enter, putting in.

feminine a large or long chair (generally made of basket-work)

āsanna

pp mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) near, near at hand; close together; ~aṃ, adv., near.
  2. (n.)
    1. nearness, vicinity; loc. ~e, adv., near, nearby; in the vicinity (of) (see āsīdati)
āsabha

mf(~ī)n. coming from or produced from a bull; bull-like; belonging to a leader; lordly.

āsaya

masculine resting-place; home, lair, nest; receptacle; the stomach.

āsava

masculine & neuter

  1. ‘inflowing’, influence (the concerns, attitudes, predispositions, listed as kāma, bhava, avijjā, and sometimes, ditthi, which form an obstacle to the realization of the truth.
  2. affliction, pain (so commentary).
  3. discharge (from a awound); of things, and so, in themselves and through the actions they motivate, bring about further existence; their ending or destruction is in fact arahatship).
āsavakkhaya

m.a ending, destruction of the āsavas, arahatship (see āsava)

āsavakhīna

mfn. with āsavas destroyed; free from the āsavas (see āsava)

āsavaṭṭhaniya

mfn. being a basis or cause of afflictions; being a basis or cause of the āsavas (see āsava)

āsasāna

part. pr. mfn or aor. (see āsiṃsati)

feminine wish, hope, expectation.

āsāṭikā

āsādana

āsādanapekkha

mfn. looking to insult, aiming to be offensive (see āsādana)

  2. a creditor.
itara

mfn. pron.

  1. the other (of two); another, other; the second; next; (pl.) the rest, the other ….
  2. other, common, ordinary, low (esp. with pajā).
itaritara

mfn. (also itarītara) one or another, whatsoever, any sort of (see itara)

itarītara

mfn. (also itaritara) one or another, whatsoever, any sort of (see itara)

iti1

ind. (before vowels except i usually taking the form ice or, occasionally, itv), in this way; so; thus (often following a clause ending with ti); iti is used especially to mark

  1. a quotation of words or thoughts
    1. before the quotation, with a verb of saying, thinking, etc.
    2. after (usually immediately after) the quotation, with or without a verb of saying, thinking, etc. (serving the purpose of inverted commas; the usual Pāḷi form is ti)
  2. a single word or name or expression; a list.
iti2

pr. 3 sg. goes; goes towards; reaches, obtains; reaches (a state); is involved (in) (see also ayati and eti)

iti c’iti ca

(?) in this way and that, thus and thus (see iti)

iti c’īti ca

(?) in this way and that, thus and thus (see iti)

iti ha

(?) (also itiha) thus indeed; so it seems; according to tradition (see iti)

itikira

feminine hearsay, tradition (see iti)

itivāda(p)pamokkhānisaṃsa

masculine & mfn.

  1. (m.) the benefit of combating criticism.
  2. (mfn.) possessing or seeking the benefit of combating criticism (see iti)
itivuttaka

n.a the name of one of the nine categories (angās) of the scriptures; one of the collections making up the Khuddakanikāya of the Pāḷi Canon (see iti)

itiha

(?) (also iti ha) thus indeed; so it seems; according to tradition (see iti)

itihāsa

masculine tradition, traditional accounts; history (see iti)

itihāsapañcama

mfn. (the vedas) with itihāsa as the fifth (see itihāsa)

itihītiha

neuter report; hearsay (see iti)

ito

ind.

  1. (used like abl. of idam) from this; than this; from here, hence; from this world.
  2. here; to here, hither.
  3. from this time, from now;
    1. preferring to the past.
    2. referring to the future.
ito … ito …

(?) from here … from there, here … there … (see ito)

ito c’ito ca

(?) from here and there; here and there (see ito)

ito nidāna

mfn. originating from this (see ito)

ito nidānaṃ

adv. as a consequence of this (see ito)

ito paraṃ

(?) from now on; after this (see ito)

mfn. fleeting; brief, temporary, limited; changeable, unreliable; inferior.

ittarajacca

mfn. of inferior birth (see ittara)

ind. (before vowels itth’) thus; in this way.

neuter the state of being thus; existence in this form; existence here.

neuter the state of being a woman; femaleness.

mfn. with a woman inside (?); with a woman driver (?) (see itthi)

masculine this sort of existence; existence in this form; existence here.

itthāgāra

neuter the women of the household; esp. the harem, a king’s wives and concubines.

itthi

itthiratana

neuter the “woman-treasure”, (one of the seven ratanas of a cakkavatti[n]) king) (see itthi)
