itthiliṅga

neuter femininity; feminine characteristics; the female sexual characteristic(s) (see itthi)

itthisoṇḍī

feminine a woman addicted to drink (see itthi)

itthī

feminine a female; a woman; a wife (see also itthi)

idaṃ1

neuter demonstr. pronoun

  1. this (referring to what is immediately present fin space or in thought]; or referring to what immediately precedes or follows).
  2. such, like that (often implying contempt); (repeated) such and such.
  3. (with rel. pronoun) whoever, whatever.
  4. (as personal pronoun) of him, of her; his, etc.
idaṃ2

neuter adv. (sometimes ida) here; now, thus; there.

idam-aṭṭhitā

feminine abstr. (also idam-atthitā) needing (only) this; requiring the minimum (see idaṃ)

idam-atthika

mfn. being for this purpose (see idaṃ)

idam-atthitā

feminine abstr. (also idam-aṭṭhitā) needing (only) this; requiring the minimum (see idaṃ)

idappaccayatā

feminine abstr. the being specific causes; causal relationship (see idaṃ)

idappaccayā

(?) because of this cause; from a specific cause (see idaṃ)

idāni

ind. now, at his moment; just now.

iddha

pp mfn. successful, prosperous, thriving, abundant (see ijjhati)

iddhabhisaṅkhāra

masculine exercise of supernatural power(s) (see iddhi)

iddhi

feminine

  1. prosperity, success; splendor; splendid attribute, accomplishment.
  2. esp. supernatural accomplishment, magic power (possessed by devas, etc, and attained by some ascetics and mendicants).
iddhipahutā

feminine mastery of or possession of supernatural power(s) (see iddhi)

iddhipāṭihāriya

neuter a marvel performed by supernatural power, a miracle; the miracle of supernatural power (one of the three marvels of the Buddha (see iddhi)

iddhipāda

masculine (& n.) a basis of supernatural power(s) (see iddhi)

iddhima(t)

mf(n). of splendid power; (one) who possesses supernatural power(s) (see iddhi)

iddhivikubbana

neuter ~ā, feminine a transformation effected by supernatural power(s); a display of magic (see iddhi)

iddhividhā

feminine ( & ~a n.) a kind or variety of supernatural power (see iddhi)

iddhivisavitā

feminine abstr. mastery of, possession of, supernatural power(s) (see iddhi)

idha

ind. here, in this place; hither; in this world; in this existence; in this case, in this connection (introducing an example or hypothesis); in this teaching, in this system.

idhaloka

masculine this world, this existence (see idha)

inda

masculine

  1. Npr. of the king of the gods; the god of the sky and atmosphere (more usually called Sakka).
  2. a chief, a lord, king.
indakhīla

masculine a post or stone set in the ground at the door of a house or palace or at the city gates against which the door or gate was closed; a threshold (see inda)

indagopaka

masculine the scarlet rain-mite (see inda)

indagopakasañchanna

mfn. covered with indagopaka; (according to commentaries) covered with red grass (see indagopaka)

indasagotta

mfn. who has the same gotra as Inda (see inda)

indriya

neuter

  1. the five (or six, including mind) sense-faculties; (the serenity of the senses is perceptible to others).
  2. five mental faculties or energies.
  3. three controlling principles.
  4. five faculties of sensation or feeling.
  5. three faculties of knowledge.
indriyatta

neuter abstr. the sate of different degrees of development of the faculties (see indriya)

ibbha

m(fn)n. a member of the kings entourage; a vassal; dependent; wealthy.

iminā upāyena

(?) in this way, thus; by this means (see upāya)

iriṇa

neuter desert, inhospitable region; barren or salt soil (also metaph.)

iriya(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see iriyati)

iriyati

pr. 3 sg. moves, moves about; behaves, conducts oneself, lives (in a certain way) (see also irīyati)

iriyamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see iriyati)

iriyā

feminine (& ~a n.) conduct; deportment, life, way of life; movement.

iriyāna

part. pr. mfn. (see iriyati)

iriyāpatha

masculine movement, mode of behavior, deportment; esp. the four bodily attitudes (walking, standing, sitting, lying) (see iriyā)

iriyāpathiya

mfn. based on (good) conduct (see iriyā)

irīyati

pr. 3 sg. moves, moves about; behaves, conducts oneself, lives (in a certain way) (see also iriyati)

iva

ind. like, as; as if, as it were; (a) sometimes combined with a preceding vowel; b) sometimes separated from a preceding vowel by a sandhi consonant, in which case a preceding long vowel is sometimes shortened; before iva (c) a preceding -aṃ sometimes becomes -am or -amm; (e) occasionally perhaps represents eva; and (f) is sometimes written as eva,

isi

masculine an inspired poet or sage of the past, esp. the authors of the Vedic hymns; a legendary seer; an ascetic or anchorite (often possessing magical powers); a sage, a seer (used usually of non-buddhists, but sometimes applied to the Buddha himself or to bhikkhus).

isikā

feminine the inner part of a reed or stalk (used as an arrow shaft); a stalk of grass (see also isīkā and īsikā)

isipatana

neuter name of a place; present sārnath near benares.

isippayāta

mfn. trodden by the isis (see isi)

isisattama

m(fn.) best of seers; or seventh of the isis.

isīkā

feminine the inner part of a reed or stalk (used as an arrow shaft); a stalk of grass (see also isikā and īsikā)

issati

pr. 3 sg. envies, resents, is jealous (of, dat./gen.)

issattha

neuter (& m.) archery.

issanti

3 plural (see iti)

issara1

mfn. and masculine

  1. (mfn.) in authority, empowered; in charge; powerful, rich.
  2. (m.)
    1. one in authority, with power; a lord, a king; a chief; a master.
    2. the Lord; the supreme deity; a creator god.

pr. 3 sg. flies up (see also uḍḍeti)

uḍḍāpeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. makes fly up; scares (see uḍḍeti)

uḍḍita

pp mfn. (also oḍḍita) strung up; fixed; laid out (see uḍḍeti)

uḍḍeti1

pr. 3 sg. flies up (see also uḍḍayati)

uḍḍeti2

uḍḍepeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. makes fly up; scares (see uḍḍeti)

  1. high, lofty; risen; raised.
  2. elated; haughty (see unnamati)

  2. raises oneself; exalts oneself; is elated (see also unnamati)

  1. wool; woolen thread.
  2. a circle of hair between the eyebrows.

uṇha

mfn. & n. (& m.)

  1. (mfn.) hot; warm.
  2. (n. m.) heat, warmth; hot weather, the hot season; what is hot, a hot object.
uṇhabhitatta

mfn. scorched and distressed by heat (see uṇha)

uṇhīsa

masculine neuter

  1. a turban, esp. the turban of a king or prince, one of the five kakudhas.
  2. the coping of a railing; a handrail (of a balustrade).

neuter hot water (see uṇha)

masculine (& f. & n.) time; proper time, special time; period, season; time of the year; season of the year (three or six); weather.

utukāla

upayanta

part. pr. mfn. (see upayāti)

upayāti

pr. 3 sg. comes near, approaches, reaches; enters (a state or condition); performs (a sacrifice); flows; flows into; flows at the full.

upayāna

neuter approach, arrival.

upayāpeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. (see upayāti)

upayāpetabba

fpp mfn. (see upayāpeti)

upayāsi

aor. 3 sg. (see upayāti)

upayupādāna

neuter & ~ā m. plural (also upayūpādāna) involvement and holding on to (see upaya)

upayūpādāna

neuter & ~ā m. plural (also upayupādāna) involvement and holding on to (see upaya)

uparajja

neuter (from uparāja) the state of being an uparāja, viceroyalty.

uparata

mfn. ceased, stopped; quiet; dead; having given up, abstaining (from).

upari

ind.

  1. (adv.) up, above, upwards; upstream; further, in addition; afterwards, later (in a text).
  2. (prep, or postp.)over, above; upon, on (+ gen. or loc.; occasionally + abl.; often written as cpd.).
uparito

ind.

  1. (adv.) upwards, above, over, on top; from above.
  2. (prep, or postp.) over, above (+ gen. or abl.).
uparipāsāda

masculine the upper terrace, the flat roof of a mansion (see upari)

uparibhāvaṅgamanīya

mfn. tending to go up, leading towards (see upari)

uparima

mfn. being above, upper, higher; later, following.

uparivehāsakutī

feminine a hut with its top story open to the air (?) (see upari)

uparujjhati

pass. pr. 3 sg. (see uparundhati)

uparuddha

pp mfn. stopped; obstructed; besieged (see uparundhati)

uparuddhati

pr. 3 sg. stops, obstructs; besieges; molests, troubles (see also uparodhati and uparundhati)

uparundhati

pr. 3 sg. stops, obstructs; besieges; molests, troubles (see also uparodhati and uparuddhati [?])

uparundhiṃ

1 sg. (see uparundhati)

uparundhiya

absol. (see uparundhati)

uparūpari

ind. more and more; higher and higher; over, on top of; right above (see upari)

uparodhati

pr. 3 sg. stops, obstructs; besieges; molests, troubles (see also uparuddhati and uparundhati)

uparodhana

neuter stopping; obstructing.

uparodheti

caus. pr. 3 sg. obstructs, injures, destroys (see uparodhati)

uparopa

masculine a plant.

upalabbhati

pass. pr. 3 sg. is found, exists; is perceived; is ascertained (see also upala[b]bhiyati)

upala(b)bhiyati

pass. pr. 3 sg. is found, exists; is perceived; is ascertained; (upalabbhati)

upalāpana

neuter ~ā, feminine persuading (to friendship), winning over (with gifts).

upalāpetabba

fpp mfn. (see upalāpeti)

upalāpeti

pr. 3 sg. treats with kindness, makes friendly overtures; wins over; persuades to friendship.

upalāpetvā

absol. (see upalāpeti)

upalāpenta

part. pr. mfn. (see upalāpeti)

upalāpesuṃ

aor. 3 sg. (see upalāpeti)

upalikkhati

pr. 3. sg. scratches, cuts, wounds.

upalimpati1

pr. 3 sg. anoints; smears; defiles.

upalimpati2

pass. pr. 3 sg. (also upalippat)

  1. is smeared, is defiled (by, instr.).
  2. is attached to, sticks, adheres (to, loc.) (see upalimpati)
upalitta

pp mfn. attached to; sticking to (see upalimpati)

upalippati

pass. pr. 3 sg. (also upalimpati [?])

  1. is smeared, is defiled (by, instr.).
  2. is attached to, sticks, adheres (to, loc.) (see upalimpati)
upaḷāsitvā

ind. making sound, playing (see also upaḷāsetvā)

upaḷāsetvā

ind. making sound, playing (see also upaḷāsitvā)

upavajja1

fpp mfn. (see upabbajati)

upavajja2

fpp mfn. to be criticized, blameworthy (see upavadati)

upavajjakula

neuter a family which can be approached (see upavajja)

upavattati

pr. 3 sg. comes near, falls to; is found, is.

upavadati

pr. 3 sg. speaks ill of, abuses, criticizes.

upavadamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see upavadati)

upavadita

pp mfn. criticized (see upavadati)

upavasati

pr. 3 sg. lives in a state of abstinence, observes (a fast or [the duties of] an uposatha day).

upavasitvā

absol. (see upavasati)

upavassa

absol. (see upavasati)

upavassaṃ

absol. (see upavasati)

upavāda

masculine criticism, blame; abuse.

upavādaka

masculine one who criticizes or abuse.

upavāyati

pr. 3 sg. blows, blows upon.

upavāyanta

part. pr. mfn. (see upavāyati)

upavāsa

masculine tenant; dependant.

upavicarati

pr. 3 sg. ranges over (mentally), considers, occupies oneself with.

upavicāra

masculine ranging over (mentally); preoccupation.

upavijañña

feminine close to giving birth, in advanced stage of pregnancy.

upaviṭṭha

pp mfn. seated.

upavisiṃ

1 sg. (I am) approaching; entering.

upavīṇa

masculine the head or neck of a vīṇa.

upavuttha

pp mfn.

  1. (act.) having fasted; having observed.
  2. (pass.) observed, kept (see upavasati)
upavutthuposatha

mfn. who has observed the uposatha day (see upavuttha)

upavhayati

pr. 3 sg. calls (to); invites.

upavhayanta

part. pr. mfn. (see upavhayati)

upasaṃyāti

pr. 3 sg. comes in a body towards.

upasaṃharati

pr. 3 sg. draws together, collects; puts together with, puts in; brings, brings near to, provides; brings about; brings into contact with; brings to bear on, focuses on; brings together (for comparison), sees as similar.

upasaṃharanta

part. pr. mf(~antī)n. (see upasaṃharati)

upasaṃhariṃsu

3 plural (see upasaṃharati)

upasaṃharitvā

absol. (see upasaṃharati)

upasaṃhasi

aor. 3 sg. (see upasaṃharati)

upasagga

masculine (also upassagga) misfortune; trouble.

upasaṅkanta

pp mfn. who has approached, gone to, visited; having approached, gone to (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkama(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkamati

pr. 3 sg. approaches; goes to, goes to see, visits.

upasaṅkamana

neuter going to see, visiting; approaching.

upasaṅkamanta

part. pr. mf(~antī)n. (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkami

aor. 3 sg. (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkamiṃsu

3 plural (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkamita(r)

inf. (from upasaṅkamati) one who approaches, goes to; one who goes to see; visits.

upasaṅkamitabba

fpp mfn. & n. impers. (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkamituṃ

inf. (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkamitvā

absol. (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkamma

absol. (see upasaṅkamati)

upasaṅkheyya

mfn. to be reckoned (as).

upasaṅgayha

ind. taking hold of, clasping.

upasaṭṭha

mfn. & neuter troubled, afflicted, visited by troubles; trouble, affliction (see also upassaṭṭha)

upasanta

pp mfn. calmed, pacified, at peace; calm, tranquil; ceased, extinguished (see upasammati)

upasantapadissa

mfn. of calm appearance, looking at peace (see upasanta)

upasama

masculine becoming quite, alleviation, stopping; calmness, peace, tranquility.

upasamati

pr. 3 sg. becomes calm or quite; ceases; is allayed, is extinguished (see also upasammati)

upasamaddhiṭṭhāna

neuter & mfn.

  1. (n.) fixing the mind on tranquillity; resolution for calmness.
  2. (mfn.)fixing the mind on tranquility; resolving for calmness (see upasama)
upasampajja

absol.

  1. reaching, attaining; having entered upon.
  2. being ordained; after ordination (see upasampajjati)
upasampajjati

pr. 3 sg. obtains; is ordained, is received into the saṅgha; obtains the upasampadā ordination.

upasampajjituṃ

inf. (see upasampajjati)

upasampadā

feminine

  1. attainment.
  2. full ordination, admission into the saṅgha.
upasampanna

pp mfn. possessed of; ordained; who is a member of the saṅgha.

upasampādayati

caus. pr. 3 sg. ordains, receives into the saṅgha (with the upasampadā ordination) (see also upasampādeti)

upasampādita

pp mfn.

  1. (mfn.) given ordination, ordained (with the upasampadā ordination).
  2. (n.) ordaining (see upasampādeti)
upasampādetabba

fpp mfn. & n. impers. (see upasampādeti)

upasampādeta(r)

masculine (from upasampādeti) one who ordains.

upasampādeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. ordains, receives into the saṅgha (with the upasampadā ordination) (see also upasampādayati)

upasampādetvā

absol. (see upasampādeti)

upasampādenta

part. pr. mf(~entī)n. (see upasampādeti)

upasampādesi

aor. 3 sg. (see upasampādeti)

upasampādesuṃ

3 plural (see upasampādeti)

upasammati

pr. 3 sg. becomes calm or quite; ceases; is allayed, is extinguished (see also upasamati)

upasāmayati

caus. pr. 3 sg. calms, makes settle.

upassagga

masculine (also upasagga) misfortune; trouble.

upasiṅghati

pr. 3 sg. smells, sniffs; kisses.

upasumbhati

pr. 3 sg. throws to.

upasussati

pr. 3 sg. dries up.

upasussayati

caus. pr. 3 sg. (see upasussati)

upasevati

pr. 3 sg. frequents, stays at; associates with, consorts with; makes use of (frequently).

upasevanā

feminine practice, performance; devotion (to); association (with); use.

upasevamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see upasevati)

upasobhati

pr. 3 sg. looks beautiful or splendid; shines, is brilliant.

upasobhayanta

part. pr. mfn. making beautiful, adorning.

upasobhita

pp mfn. made beautiful, adorned; beautiful (see upasobhati)

upassaṭṭha

mfn. & neuter troubled, afflicted, visited by troubles; trouble, affliction (see also upasaṭṭha)

upassaya

masculine (& n.) support; shelter, refuge; dwelling, place to stay; recourse, resorting to.

upassutiṃ

adv. within earshot; so as to listen or overhear.

upahacca

absol. coming into contact with, reaching; harming; making impure or ill disposed (see upahanati)

upahaccaparinibbāyi(n)

mfn. who realizes nibbāna in the latter half of his existence in one of the suddhāvāsas (see upahacca)

upahaññati

pass. pr. 3 sg. is harmed, is damaged; suffers (see upahanati)

upahata

pp mfn. harmed, injured, impaired; upset, spoiled; made impure or ll-disposed.

upahatta(r)

masculine one who brings, who presents.

upahanati

pr. 3 sg. hits, comes into contact with, reaches; hurts, damages, impairs (see also upahanti)

upahanti

pr. 3 sg. hits, comes into contact with, reaches; hurts, damages, impairs (see also upahanati)

upahantvāna

absol. (see upahanati)

upaharati

pr. 3 sg. brings, brings near; offers, presents.

upahāra

masculine bringing; offering; present, presentation; service.

upahiṃsati

pr. 3 sg. hurts, injures.

upāgacchiṃ

1 sg. (see upagacchati)

upāgañchiṃ

1 sg. (see upagacchati)

upāgata

mfn. who has approached; arrived at; entered into (a state or condition).

upāgamaṃ

1 sg. (see upagacchati)

upāgami

aor. 3 sg. (see upagacchati)

upāgamiṃ

1 sg. (see upagacchati)

upāgamuṃ

3 plural (see upagacchati)

upāgamma

ind. approaching; having entrered upon; beings subject to.

upāgā

aor 3 sg. approached; arrived at; (also upāgā)

upātigā

(?) go past, pass by; go beyond, escape from; overcome.

upātidhāvati

pr. 3 sg. runs beyond, rushes over.

upātipanna

mfn. fallen into the power of, a prey to (+loc.).

upātivatta

pp mfn. gone beyond, free from (see upativattati)

upātivatta(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see upātivattati)

upātivattati

pr. 3 sg. goes beyond; escapes from; transgresses; oversteps.

upātivattatittho

aor. 2 sg. (see upātivattati)

upādahati

pr. 3 sg. places upon; lays upon, imposes (see also upadaheti)

upādaheti

pr. 3 sg. places upon; lays upon, imposes (see also upadahati)

upādāna

neuter

  1. taking as one’s own, laying hold of, grasping.
  2. material support or cause, fuel; (it is often difficult to determine which meaning is intended; both reinforce each other: previous grasping produces fuel, which is itself then grasped).
upādānakkhandha

masculine one of the five groups of the elements of existence connected with grasping (as cause or object) (and being material support or fuel) (see upādāna)

upādāniya

mfn. (from upādāna) likely to be taken as one’s own, tending to produce grasping; serving as a support or fuel.

upādāya

absol.

  1. taking for oneself taking as one’s own, adopting; making use of, having as material support or cause; being evolved or deriving (from, gen.).
  2. (postp., + acc. or gen.), with, out of because of; with reference to, in respect of; relative to, in comparison with.
  3. including; beginning from (see upādiyati)
upādiṇṇa

pp mfn. (also upādinna)

  1. taken hold of, taken for one’s own; grasped; used.
  2. evolved, derived, esp. evolved by the influence of previous kamma (usually explained by commentaries as meaning 1.); animate.
  3. not holding on to, not grasping (see upādiyati)
upādinna

pp mfn. (also upādiṇṇa)

  1. taken hold of, taken for one’s own; grasped; used.
  2. evolved, derived, esp. evolved by the influence of previous kamma (usually explained by commentaries as meaning (1) animate.
  3. not holding onto, not grasping (see upādiyati)
upādiya(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see upādiyati)

upādiyati

pr. 3 sg. appropriates to oneself, takes as one’s own, adopts; lays hold of, grasps; uses; takes as material source, derives, evolves (from).

upādiyamāna

part.pr. mfn. (see upādiyati)

upādiyiṃ

aor. 3 sg. (see upādiyati)

upādiyitvā

absol. (see upādiyati)

upādisesa

masculine a remnant of material support or fuel; a residue of grasping.

upāya

masculine (& mfn.)

  1. (m.) way, means; expedient; appropriate way, successful means; strategy, stratagem.
  2. (mfn.) going to; being involved.
upāyakosalla

neuter knowledge about the appropriate way or means (see upāya)

upāyaññu

mfn. knowing the means, knowing the way (see upāya)

upāyāsa

masculine trouble, unrest; annoyance, irritation.

upāyāsabahula

mfn. irritable, easily annoyed (see upāyāsa)

upāyāsita

mfn. troubled, irritated.

upāyupādāna

neuter & ~ā, m. plural (also upāyūpādāna) involvement and holding on to (see upāya)

upāyūpādāna

neuter & ~ā, m. plural (also upāyupādāna) involvement and holding on to (see upāya)

upāyena

instr. adv. skilfully; in the right way; by a stratagem (see upāya)

upāraddha

pp. mfn. criticized; challenged, confuted (see upārambhati)

upārambha

masculine reproof, criticism, faultfinding; argumentative challenge.

upārambhacitta

mfn. critical, finding fault, captious (see upārambha)

upārambhati

pr. 3 sg. criticizes, finds fault; challenges, confutes.

upārambhānisaṃsa

mfn. useful for argumentative challenge, thinking it useful for argumentative challenge (see upārambha)

upāvisi

aor. 3 sg. useful for argumentative.

upāvisiṃ

1 sg. challenge, thinking it useful for argumentative.

upāvisuṃ

3 plural challenge.

upāsaka

masculine a lay-follower, a lay-disciple (of the Buddha) (see also upāsikā)

upāsati

pr. 3 sg. sits near, stays near; waits upon, serves, is devoted to; approaches; approaches respectfully.

upāsana

neuter shooting (arrows); practice (of archery); practicing (a skill).

upāsamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see upāsati)

upāsikā

feminine a female lay-follower, female lay-disciple (of the Buddha) (see also upāsaka)

upāsita

pp mfn. served, honored (see upāsati)

upāsita(r)

masculine (from upāsati) one who serves, who honors.

upāsituṃ

inf. (see upāsati)

upāhanapappoṭhanasadda

masculine the sound of the knocking of sandals (see upāhanā)

upāhanā

feminine ~a, masculine a sandal; a pair of sandals; slippers.

upekkha

mfn. disinterested, unaffected.

upekkhaka

mfn. disinterested, unaffected, uninvolved.

upekkhati

pr. 3 sg. looks on (without involvement or reaction or action); is disinterested, unaffected.

upekkhā

feminine disinterestedness, unaffectedness (one of the brahmavihāras q.v.); lack of involvement or reaction.

upekkhāsahagata

mfn. associated with disinterestedness, accompanied by disinterestedness (see upekkhā)

upekkhindriya

neuter the faculty of disinterestedness, lack of reaction (see upekkhā)

upecca

absol. (see upeti)

upeta

pp mfn.

  1. .(act.) who has approached, reached; having accepted.
  2. (pass.)
    1. reached, accepted.
    2. accompanied by, furnished with, possessed of (see upeti)
upetabba

fpp mfn. (see upeti)

upeti

pr. 3 sg. approaches, comes or goes to, arrives at, reaches; enters into (a state), undergoes.

accepts

acknowledges; is fit for is fitting, applies.

upenta

part. pr. mfn. (see upeti)

upessaṃ

1 sg. (see upeti)

uposatha

masculine

  1. (for non-buddhists) a fastday, a day of purification; (for Buddhists) a day on which lay-followers undertake to observe eight abstinence and on which they listen to teaching on the dhamma (usually the day preceding the nights of the new moon and the full moon, and the night midway between the two, i.e. the eighth, fourteenth and/or fifteenth days of the lunar fortnight; sometimes also the fifth day); the observance of this day; the abstinence undertaken on this day.
  2. the day on which the saṅgha assembles to confess any faults and to recite the pātimokkha q.v. (usually the fourteenth or fifteenth day of the lunar fortnight); the ceremony or (formal) act on this day.
uposathakamma

neuter the (formal) act (of the saṅgha) on an uposatha day (see uposatha)

uposathagga

neuter an area in front of the uposatha hall (from where the uposatha ceremony can be heard) (see uposatha)

uposathagāra

neuter a hall for the uposatha ceremony (of the saṅgha) (see uposatha)

uposathaṅga

neuter one of the eight abstinence (observed by the lay-followers on an uposatha day) (see uposatha)

uposathapucchaka

neuter questioning about the (day of the) uposatha ceremony (see uposatha)

uposatha(p)pamukha

neuter a hall for the uposatha ceremony (of the saṅgha) (see uposatha)

uposathika

mfn.

  1. (a meal) connected with the uposatha day.
  2. fasting; observing the uposatha abstinence; keeping the uposatha day.
uposathūpavāsa

masculine observance of the duties of the uposatha day (see uposatha)

uppakka

pp mfn. (as if) boiled or inflamed; (red and) swollen (see also upakka)

uppacca

absol. (see uppatati)

uppajjati

pr. 3 sg. arises, comes into being; appears, is produced; becomes available.

uppajjamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see uppajjati)

uppajji

aor. 3 sg. (see uppajjati)

uppajjitvā

absol. (see uppajjati)

uppajjiyati

pass. pr. 3 sg. is brought into being, is produced; is made available (see uppajjati)

uppaṭipāṭikasutta

neuter “different order sutta” (title).

uppaṇḍita

pp mfn. mocked; derided (see uppandeti)

uppaṇḍiyamāna

pass. part. pr. mfn. (see uppaṇḍeti)

uppaṇḍu

mfn. very yellowish; very pale.

uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajāta

mfn. extremely yellow; extremely pale (see uppaṇḍu)

uppaṇḍeti

pr. 3 sg. mocks; derides.

uppaṇḍesuṃ

3 plural (see uppaṇḍeti)

uppata(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see uppatati)

uppatati

pr. 3 sg. flies upwards; jumps up, leaps up; rises.

uppatanta

part. pr. mfn. (see uppatati)

uppatita

pp mfn. springing up; sprung into being, arisen (see uppatati)

uppatitvā

absol. (see uppatati)

uppatti

feminine arising, coming into being, birth.

uppatha

masculine what is not the path; a path away from the right road; the wrong road, the wrong way.

uppanna

pp mfn. arisen, come into being; appeared; produced, available (see uppajjati)

uppala

neuter

  1. the blue lotus (Nymphaea caerulea); any lotus.
  2. the name of a hell or place in Avīci (where one suffers for an uppala of years).
uppalaka

masculine the name of a hell or place in Avīci (where one suffers for an uppala[ka] of years).

uppalagandhapaccatthika

masculine an enemy who is an “uppalagandha” robber (?) (see uppala)

uppalavati

pr. 3 sg. swims (up); floats, floats around; leaps up, jumps; is frisky, excited (see also uppilavati, upplavati and uplavati)

uppalasikharopama

mfn. like the bud of the blue lotus (see uppala)

uppalinī

feminine a multitude or clump of lotuses; a lotus pond.

uppāṭaka

masculine an insect.

uppāṭiya

absol. having torn asunder; having rooted out; having skinned.

uppāṭetvā

absol. having torn asunder; having rooted out; having skinned.

uppāṭesi

aor. 3 sg. tore asunder; rooted out; skinned.

uppāta

masculine an unusual or startling event, taken as a portent; the interpretation of portents (see also uppāda)

uppāda1

masculine an unusual or startling event, taken as a portent; theinterpretation of portents (see also uppāta)

uppāda2

masculine coming into being, appearance; production.

uppādaya(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see uppādeti)

uppādayati

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also uppādeti) causes to issue forth or appear; produces, generates, brings into being (see uppajjati)

uppādita

pp mfn. produced; generated (see uppajjati)

uppādetabba

fpp mfn. (see uppajjati)

uppādeta(r)

masculine one who brings into being, who produces.

uppādeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also uppādayati) causes to issue forth or appear; produces, generates, brings into being (see uppajjati)

uppādetvā

absol. (see uppādeti)

uppādesi

aor. 3 sg. (see uppādeti)

uppilavati

pr. 3 sg. swims (up); floats, floats around; leaps up, jumps; is frisky, excited (see also uppalavati, upplavati and uplavati)

uppilāvitatta

neuter abstr. elation; exhilaration (see uppilavati)

upplavati

pr. 3 sg. swims (up); floats, floats around; leaps up, jumps; is frisky, excited (see also uppilavati, upplavati and uplavati)

upphāletvā

ind. splitting, opening up.

uplavati

pr. 3 sg. swims (up); floats, floats around; leaps up, jumps; is frisky, excited (see also uppalavati, uppilavati and upplavati)

ubbaṭuma

mfn. off the road.

ubbaṭṭayati

caus. pr. 3 sg. massages, rubs (with unguents) (see also ubbaṭṭeti)

ubbaṭṭeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. massages, rubs (with unguents) (see also ubbaṭṭayati)

ubbandhitvā

pr. 3 sg. having hung up; having strangled.

ubbādhanā

feminine oppression, harassment; paining.

ubbāhapetabba

fpp mfn. causing to carry.

ubbāhapeti

eka

num. & mfn.

    1. one; only one; a single; one of two or many.
    2. one only, one and the same.
    3. (indefinite:) one, a certain; a, an.
  2. alone; solitary.
  3. one and only, unique; preeminent.
  4. all one; nothing but.
  5. (pl.) some; some people; some authorities.
eka … apara …

(?) one … another …; one … the other … (see eka)

eka … eka …

(?) one … another …; one … the other … (see eka)

eka … dutiya …

(?) one … another …; one … the other … (see eka)

ekadhippāya

masculine & mfn. single interpretation; a single wish or intention; what is meant or intended for one; having a single wish or intention; having a single interpretation, conveying only one sense (see eka)

ekaṃsa1

masculine

  1. one part.
  2. certainty; absolute assurance (see eka)
ekaṃsa2

masculine & mfn.

  1. (m.) one shoulder.
  2. (mfn.) (or ekaṃsaṃ, ind.) on one shoulder, covering one shoulder (the left) (see eka)
ekaṃsabhavita

mfn. developed in one part; practiced for one aspect (see ekaṃsa)

ekaṃsavacana

neuter an expression of certainty or affirmation (see ekaṃsa)

ekaṃsavāda

mfn. speaking with absolute certainty; having absolute views (see ekaṃsa)

ekaṃsavyākaraṇiya

mfn. answerable; to be answered with certainty, or with an absolute affirmation (see ekaṃsa)

ekaṃsika

mfn. determined; certain; assured (see eka)

ekaṃsena

instr. adv. with certainty, with assurance; certainly, absolutely, definitely (see ekaṃsa)

ekaka

mf(-ikā)n. & masculine

  1. (mfn.)
    1. alone; by oneself; only…; a single; the only…
    2. having one; having a single (verse)
  2. (m.)
    1. a group of one; a set consisting of a single item.
    2. (or perhaps n.) a section dealing with groups of one.
ekakamma

neuter & mfn. a single or the same official act (of the saṅgha) (see eka)

ekakuṭika

mfn. consisting of a single house (see eka)

ekagārika1

neuter attacking and robbing isolated houses (see eka)

ekagārika2

m(fn). taking alms only from one house (see eka)

ekaguṇaṃ

ind. once (see eka)

ekagga

mfn. & masculine

  1. (mfn.) having one point, (with attention) fixed on one point or object; closely attentive, intent; esp. concentrated in samādhi.
  2. (m.) concentration on one object, intentness; calm (see eka)
ekaggacitta

mfn. with mind intent, with thoughts concentrated on one object (see ekagga)

ekaggatā

feminine concentration on one object, intentness; calm (see ekagga)

ekaghana

mfn. being a single mass; quite solid (see eka)

ekaṅga

neuter one part; one characteristic; one factor (see eka)

ekaṅgadassi(n)

mfn. seeing only one part, one aspect (see ekaṅga)

ekaṅgahīna

mfn. deficient in one respect; lacking one attribute (see ekaṅga)

ekacara

mfn. going about or living alone; solitary (see eka)

ekacariyā

feminine going about or living alone, solitariness; a solitary life (see eka)

ekacāri(n)

mfn. going about or living alone; solitary (see eka)

ekacca

pron. & mfn.

    1. a, a certain; someone, something; anyone; (pi.) some, certain; some people.
    2. a part of; some of it; some …, some of…; some of them
  2. (repeated) one… another…; someone… someone…; some … others ….
ekacca-asassatika

mfn. believing in the non-eternality of some things (see ekacca)

ekacca-sassatika

mfn. believing in the eternality of some things; professing partial eternalism (see ekacca)

ekaccika

mfn. single, of a single thickness (see also ekacciya)

ekacciya1

mfn. single, of a single thickness (see also ekaccika)

ekacciya2

mfn. a certain, a certain sort of; some.

ekachiggala

mfn. (also ekacchiggaḷa) having one hole (see eka)

ekachiggaḷa

mfn. (also ekacchiggala) having one hole (see eka)

ekaja

mfn. born once (see eka)

ekajāla

mfn. a single mass of flames; being a single mass of flames (see eka)

ekajjhaṃ

ind. at one time; in one place; together, altogether.

ekaṭṭha

masculine & mfn. (also ekattha) having one meaning; having the same sense (see eka)

ekatiya

mfn. a certain; some.

ekato

ind.

  1. on one side, on one part; on each side; to one side; separately.
  2. all on one side, in one body; together.
ekato … ekato …

(?) on one side …; on the other side … (see ekato)

ekatokāja

masculine a carrying pole with a load at one end (see ekato)

ekatodhāra

mfn. with a single cutting edge (see ekato)

ekatopakkhika

mfn. supporting one side, belonging to one party (see ekato)

ekatovaṇṭikamālā

feminine a garland with stalk(s) on one side (see ekato)

ekato-upasampanna

mfn. ordained in (only) one saṅgha) (see ekato)

ekatta1

neuter abstr. the being one;

  1. oneness, unity; identity; integration; a collective idea; a single concept; the single number, the singular;
  2. singleness, being alone, solitariness (see eka)
ekatta2

mfn. onl, being the only one; unique; of one nature, of a single kind, uniform (see eka)

ekattakāya

mfn. having bodies of the same nature, having uniform bodies (see ekatta)

ekattanirata

mfn. (or n.) devoted to (or devotion to) solitariness or unity (see ekatta)

ekattavāsa

masculine living together (see ekatta)

ekattasaññi(n)1

ekattasaññi(n)2

mfn. having perceptions or notions of the same nature; (ekattasaññi[n]) (see ekatta)

  1. (num.) 31.
  2. (mfn.) 31st (see eka)

  2. (mfn.) 31st (see eka)

ind. once, at one time; at some time; sometimes.

  1. (m.) one place; one part.
  2. (mfn.) one part of, some of; in part (see eka)

ekantaṃkusalāyatika

mfn. (according to commentary) coming from what is absolutely good, resulting form what is good; or perhaps; producing what is absolutely good in the future (see ekantaṃ)

ekantaṃgata

mfn. with utter devotion or certainty; taking one side; following one alternative (see ekantaṃ)

ekantaṃgatalomī

ekabhattika

mfn. eating only one meal a day; eating only before noon (see eka)

mfn. fixing the mind upon one thing; attentive (see eka)

ekamūlika

mfn. (also ekamūlaka) (what is) based on one item; (a statement or exposition) concerned with one item (see eka)

ekam antaṃ

adv. (or eka-m-antaṃ)

  1. to one side (showing respect); at a respectful distance.
  2. on one side, aside; out of the way; a little apart.
  3. to one side, apart; at a distance; in private, on one’s own.
  4. in one place; in a single place (see eka)
eka-m-antaṃ

adv. (or ekam antaṃ)

  1. to one side (showing respect); at a respectful distance.
  2. on one side, aside; out of the way; a little apart.
  3. to one side, apart; at a distance; in private, on one’s own.
  4. in one place; in a single place (see eka)
eka-m-ante

  2. any one (of several), one or the other; just one; a single one (see eka)

eja

masculine or neuter disturbance, emotion.

ejā

mfn. with legs like the black antelope’s (one of the 32 characteristics of a mahāpurisa).

mfn. with legs like the black antelope’s.

eṇeyyaka

neuter a kind of torture.

etageha

mfn. having longings for this, desiring this (see eta[d])

eta(d)

demonstr. pronoun. this (referring to what is nearest in space or in thought; or to what immediately precedes or follows); often pointing out someone or something: here is …, there is ….

etadatthiya

mfn. having this purpose; useful for this (see eta[d])

etadantika

mfn. having this as an end, having an end here; ending thus (see eta[d])

etadohi

ind. this as limit; to this limit, as far as this (see eta[d])

etaparama

mfn. having this (which usually follows) as their highest limit, i.e. only as good as this, no better than this; only as great as this, no more than this (see eta[d])

etaparamaṃ

acc. adv. as well as, only as well as, on as much as (see etaparama)

etarahi

ind. now; a this time; nowadays, at the present time; esp. (a) in relation to the past and/or future; parallel (in direct speech) to tena kho pana samayena (+ historic present).

etase

inf. (see eti)

etave

inf. (see eti)

etādisa

mf(~ā & ~ī)n. such (a), of such a kind; such as (with or without correlative).

etādisikā

(m)f(n). such (a), of such a kind.

etāva(t)

mfn. so great, of such extent.

etāvataparama

mfn. having such as its highest limit, i.e. only as good as such, only so great (see etāva[t])

etāvataparamaṃ

acc. adv. only to such an extent, only as greatly (see etāvataparama)

eti1

pr. 3 sg. goes; goes towards; reaches, obtains; reaches (a state); is involved (in) (see also ayati and iti)

eti2

pr. 3 sg. comes, comes to; approaches; comes back, returns.

etena upāyena

(?) in this way, thus; by this means (see upāya)

etta

mfn. so much, just so much.

ettaka

mf(~ā & ettikā)n. such; so much, so great; so many; this much (expressing a total); just so much, only so much (and no more).

ettakaṃ

acc. adv. so much; so long (see ettaka)

ettakena

instr. by so much; to such an extent (see ettaka)

ettāvatā

ind. by just so much, with this much; to such an extent; so far, to that extent; thus.

etto

ind. from here, from there; than this; that way.

ettha

ind. here; there; (functioning as loc. of eta[d] in this, in these; in regard to this or these; in this respect; in this case, in that case; in these circumstances.

etthantare

(?) in this interval (of time or space); in the time between these; in the area between these; in the meantime (see ettha)

etha

imperat. (also ehi) used especially as introductory particles of exhortation, encouragement or summons (followed usually by an imperat. or fut.): come! come on! (see eti)

edisa

mf(~ā & ~ī)n. like this, like so; such a …; of such a kind; such a thing, something like this.

edisaka

mfn.a like this, like so; of such a kind; such a thing.

edha

mfn. growing, prospering.

edhati

  1. prospers, grows strong; becomes happy.
  2. finds; obtains.
edhittha

aor. 3 sg. (see edhati)

ena

mfn. pron. him, her, it (referring to someone or something already mentioned); this, that; this one.

em

ind. so; in this way.

neuter a kind of torture.

erita

elamūga

eḷamūga

mfn. unintelligent, stupid (as a sheep); (perhaps with association with impaired speech) (see also elamūga)

eva1

ind.

  1. that very…, the same …; exactly that…; just ….
  2. only, merely, just.
  3. indeed, really; certainly; absolutely; even, still.
  4. eva is especially common in combination with other particles, e.g.: c’eva… ca …, both … and ….
eva2

ind. like, as; as it were.

n’eva … na

(?) neither … nor … (see eva)

n’eva … no

(?) neither … nor … (see eva)

evaṃ

ind.

  1. so in this way; in such a way; like this.
  2. referring to what follows.
  3. expressing assent.
  4. introducing the second part of a comparison (often as evam eva or evam evam).
evaṃkāri(n)

mfn. acting this way (see evaṃ)

evaṃgata

mfn. in such a state; of such a kind (see evaṃ)

evaṃgatika

evaṃvādi(n)

mfn. living in such a state or way (see evaṃ)

evaṃsaddha

evadassi(n)

evam eva

(?) just so, just like that (see eva)

evarūpa

mf(~ā & ~ī)n. & neuter of such a kind, like this; such a thing; usually

  1. referring to something just mentioned or summing up a description just given: such a…; like that; such a thing; or
  2. introducing a description or definition or list: as follows; such as the following; like this….
evācāra

mfn. of such behavior, of such conduct.

imperat. (also etha) used especially as introductory particles of exhortation, encouragement or summons (followed usually by an imperat. or fut.): come! come on! (see eti)

ehibhadantika

ehibhikkhunī

oka

masculine neuter house, home; resort, refuge.

okacara

oka-ñ-jaha

okaḍḍhati

okantati

okapuṇṇa

mfn. soaked with water.

okappanīya

fpp mfn. to believe; to trust.

okappeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. considers as possible, believes likely, gives credence to; trusts, has confidence (in, ace. or gen./dat.); is sure (about).

oka-m-okata

ind. from its home, the water; from a watery home (see also oka-m-okato)

oka-m-okato

okampetvā

okassa

okasāri(n)

okkassayati

pr. 3 sg. draws down or out.

okāra

masculine degradation, demeaning.

okāsa

masculine space, room; place, area; occasion, opportunity; possibility, chance.

okāsaṃ karoti

(?) makes a space; gives way; gives the opportunity (esp. for speech); allows, permits; consents (see okāsa)

okāsaṃ kārāpeti

(?) causes to give an opportunity; obtains consent; gains permission (esp. to speak) (see okāsa)

okāsaṃ kāreti

(?) causes to give an opportunity; obtains consent; gains permission (esp. to speak) (see okāsa)

okāseti

pr. 3 sg. puts down; scatters.

pp mfn. bestrewn, covered with; surrounded by (see okirati)

mfn. dwarfish.

pp. entered; fallen into; come on.

feminine coming down (into); entering (the womb), conception.

ka

masculine feminine who? what? which …? (frequently followed by particles, esp. by nu, nu kho, (s)su, ssa); who are you who…?; sometimes expressing indignation: who does he think he is to …? who are you to…?; ka followed by ca (or pi) and preceded by ya: whoever, whatever; whichever …; ka followed by ci [koci] or before eva, cid), and sometimes preceded by ya (sg. acc. m. kañci and kiñci): whoever, whatever, whichever…; anyone whatsoever; anyone, anything; some …; any … (see also kiṃ)

ka cana

(?) (sg. acc. m. kañcanaṃ); someone; anyone (see ka)

ka ci

(?) ka + ci repeated; of whatever kind; of some kind or other (see ka)

neuter a dark substance or dye, probably copper sulphate, blue vitriol (see kaṃsa)

masculine a dealer in metal (goods) (see kaṃsa)

mfn.

  1. doubting; being uncertain.
  2. desiring, hoping for.
kaṅgu

feminine a kind of grain, panic seed.

kacavara

m (& n. [?]) dust, sweepings; rubbish.

kacci

ind. when followed by nu sometimes, in verse, taking the form kaccin) interrogative particle introducing a question. Often expecting or, more usually, hoping for the answer ‘yes’: “I hope that…”, “surely …”. Occasionally fearing or suspecting the answer ‘yes’: “perhaps …”, “I fear that…”.

kacci … na …

(?) I hope that… not …; surely … not… (see kacci)

kaccha1

masculine neuter a forest, esp. a dry wood; deadwood; under wood.

kaccha2

m.(& n. [?] pl. acc. ~āni) the armpit.

kaccha3

masculine (see also kacchā) a girdle, belt, esp. the girth of an elephant; the end of the lower garment (brought up behind and tucked into the waistband).

kaccha4

masculine neuter marshy ground; a water-meadow; (according to commentaries) an upland meadow, a meadow on a hillside.

kaccha5

masculine neuter growing (naturally) in a meadow; (from a natural wood;)

kaccha6

mfn. fit to be spoken to (see katheti)

kacchaka

masculine a kind of fig tree, perhaps Cedrela toona.

kacchapa

masculine a turtle; a tortoise.

kacchamāna

part. pr. mfn. speaking; telling; recounting; teaching.

kacchā

feminine (see also kaccha) a girdle, belt, esp. the girth of an elephant; the end of the lower garment (brought up behind and tucked into the waistband).

kacchū

feminine the itch, scabies.

kaṭuka

mfn. & neuter (mfn.) sharp, disagreeable; (of taste) pungent, acrid (as peppers or ginger); (of words) bitter, caustic; (of pain etc) severe, keen, keenly distressing; (n.) a bitter thing, a distressing thing.

kaṭukatara

mfn. comp. more bitter (see kaṭuka)

kaṭukapabhedana

mfn. exuding pungent juice from its temples (see kaṭuka)

kaṭukapphala

mfn. having bitter fruit; producing distressing results (see kaṭuka)

kaṭukarohiṇī

feminine the plant Heleborus niger (see kaṭuka)

kaṭuviya

neuter (or mfn.) (according to et) (what is) left over; (what is) polluted, impure.

kaṭuviyakata

mfn. left over; polluted, impure (see kaṭuka)

kaṭūpaga

mfn. (also kaṭūpiya) belonging to, fit for the hips (see kaṭi)

kaṭūpiya

mfn. (also kaṭūpaga) belonging to, fit for the hips (see kaṭi)

kaṭṭha1

neuter wood; a piece of wood, a stick, a twig; esp. wood used as fuel, kindling, firewood.

kaṭṭha2

pp mfn. plowed (see kasati)

kaṭṭhaka

masculine a kind of reed or bamboo.

kaṭṭhatāla

neuter a wooden key (see kaṭṭha)

kaṭṭhatumba

kaṭṭhapuñja

masculine a pile of sticks, a heap of firewood (see kaṭṭha)

kaṭṭhahāra

masculine ~ī, feminine one who gathers sticks or firewood (see kaṭṭha)

kaṭṭhahāraka

mf(-ikā) (one) who gathers sticks or firewood (see kaṭṭha)

kaṭṭhissa

neuter a silken covering embroidered with jewels.

kaṭhala

masculine n. & ~ā feminine gravel; a pebble; a fragment (of earthenware), a potsherd (see also kathala)

kaṭhali

feminine (?) potsherd; scraper (see also kathali)

kaṭhita

pp mfn. hot, boiling, seething (see also kuthita)

kaṭhina

neuter a framework (covered with a mat) to which the cloth for making robes was attached while being sewn; esp. kaṭhinaṃ attharati

  1. spreads or covers the kaṭhina, i.e. makes a robe using the kaṭhina.
  2. participates, at the end of the rains-residence, in a communal robe-making, during which certain rules and practices are suspended (perhaps in order to facilitate the robe making); this involves: a) a saṅghakamma allotting the material (and the use of the kaṭhina) to a bhikkhu according to need and seniority; b) the preparation of the robe, by all the participating bhikkhus, from washing the cloth to adding the kappabindu the approval of the robe by one or more bhikkhus . Only those can take part and share the privileges who have spent the earlier rain-retreat within that sīmā and have participated in the pavāranā ceremony. A minimum of five bhikkhus is required, but unqualified ones may make up the number without sharing the privileges. The donor gives cloth, sewing materials and food to the participating bhikkhus . The whole process must be completed in one day.
  3. displays the finished robe.
kaṭhinaṃ attharataṃ1

neuter

  1. As well as referring to the literal covering of the kaṭhina and the proper carrying-out of the communal robe making, also describes a state existing in an āvāsa where qualified bhikkhu have a claim on material given to the saṅgha (and on the use of the kaṭhina) and enjoy the five concessions or privileges; at the end of five months (or earlier by decision of the saṅgha) this special state is ended (kaṭhinam uddhariyati, the kaṭhina is removed or put away, ubbhataṃ); the claims and privileges of individual bhikkhus end at this time, or before, if they leave the āvāsa, not intending to return.
  2. the kaṭhina robemaking and ritual; (the materials for) the kaṭhina ceremony.
kaṭhinaṃ attharataṃ2

(?) also implies that the special concessions associated with the kaṭhina ritual are in force (see atthaṭa)

kaṭhinaṃ anattharataṃ

(?) also implies that the special concessions associated with the kaṭhina ritual are not in force (see atthaṭa)

kaṭhinaka

(mf)n.

  1. the chapter concerned with kaṭhina.
  2. (the section listing) the kaṭhina sikkhāpadas and those having a similar origin.
kaṭhinattharaṇa

neuter the covering of the kaṭhina ; the communal robe making and its ritual (see kaṭhina)

kaṭhinatthāra

masculine id. the covering of the kaṭhina ; the communal robe making and its ritual (see kaṭhina)

kaṭhinatthāraka

masculine one who covers the kaṭhina ; who supervises the making of the robe (which becomes his) (see kaṭhina)

kaṭhinadussa

neuter cloth (to be made up) on the kaṭhina (see kaṭhina)

kaṭhinarajju

feminine the cord for (tying the robe material to) the kaṭhina (see kaṭhina)

kaṭhinasamuṭṭhāna

neuter the section listing the kaṭhina sikkhāpadas and those sikkhāpadas having a similar origin (see kaṭhina)

kaṭhinuddhāra

masculine removal of the kaṭhina ; ending of the kaṭhina ; ending of the kaṭhina period (and of its special allowances) (see kaṭhina)

kaṭhinubbhāra

masculine id. removal of the kaṭhina ; ending of the kaṭhina ; ending of the kaṭhina period (and of its special allowances) (see kaṭhina)

ind. (before vowels sometimes kath’) how? in what way? how is it that …? what … like?; kathaṃ is often followed by one or more particles:katham preceded by yathä, however? in what way.

kathan nu (kho)

kappa

masculine n. & masculine

  1. (m. n.)
    1. an aeon, a cycle of the world’s evolution and dissolution; one stage of a cycle; a very long period of time.
    2. a (limited) length of time
  2. (m.n.) an allowable practice; an allowance, a concession.
  3. (m.) [kappabiṇḍu], a round mark (to legitimize or identify a robe).
  4. (m.n.) one side of an argument, an alternative; a (false) supposition, imagining; a theory; a figment.
kappaṃ

acc. adv. for an eon; for a very long time (see kappa)

kappaṃ-jaha

mfn. abandoning theories or figments (see kappa)

kappaka

masculine a barber, hairdresser; a valet, a personal attendant.

kappakata

mfn. (what is) made proper, made allowable; marked with the kappabiṇḍu.

pr. 3 sg. is suitable to, is fitting; for (+gen./dat., occasionally + loc.); is allowed, is lawful.

fpp. mfn. (see kappāpeti)

kappāpeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. causes to be harnessed or prepared; has dressed or trimmed (see kappati)

kappātetvā

absol. (see kappāpeti)

kappaya(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see kappayati)

kappayati

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also kappeti)

  1. prepares, fits out; sets in order, arranges, dresses.
  2. performs; produces, effects; brings about; esp. as auxiliary to nouns, e.g. jīvikaṃ ~eti, jīvitaṃ ~eti, lives; makes one’s living; trims, cuts.
  3. frames, imagines; invents, contrives; theorizes (about) (see kappati)
kappayiṃsu

aor. 3 sg. (see kappeti)

masculine the elbow.

kappiya1

mfn. according to the rule; lawful, allowable, acceptable; (for bhikkhus and bhikkhunīs); suitable, proper; (what is) proper.

kappiya2

mfn. to be imagined, to be theorized about; subject to imaginings or theories.

kappiyakāraka

masculine one who makes something lawful or acceptable (for bhikkhus or bhikkhunīs, or for other ascetics, e.g. by offering to them things without an owner or by using money to provide robes); one who acts for bhikkhus or bhikkhunīs (see kappiya)

kappiyakuṭī

feminine a hut or building used for storing or preparing lawful goods or food (see kappiya)

kappetabba

fpp mfn. (see kappeti)

kappeta(r)

masculine one who effects, brings about.

kappeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also kappayati)

  1. prepares, fits out; sets in order, arranges, dresses.
  2. performs; produces, effects; brings about; esp. as auxiliary to nouns, e.g. jīvikaṃ ~eti, jīvitaṃ ~eti, lives; makes one’s living; trims, cuts.
  3. frames, imagines; invents, contrives; theorizes (about) (see kappati)
kappetvā

absol. (see kappeti)

kappesi

aor. 3 sg. (see kappeti)

kappesuṃ

3 plural (see kappeti)

kabaracchāya

mfn. with dapple or patchy shade.

kabala

masculine neuter a lump of food; a mouthful (see also kabaḷa)

kabalāvacchedakaṃ

kabaliṅkāra

mfn. (of food) solid, material; (food) to be swallowed (see also kabaḷīkāra)

kabaḷa

masculine neuter a lump of food; a mouthful (see also kabala)

kabaḷikā

feminine a poultice, a compress.

kabaḷīkāra

mfn. (of food) solid, material; (food) to be swallowed (see also kabaḷiṅkāra)

kabandha

masculine neuter a headless trunk of the body (usually alive, or at least capable of movement) (see also kavandha)

kamaṇḍalu

masculine f., neuter a water-vessel, water-jar (used by ascetics and brahmans).

kamaṇḍaluka

masculine f., neuter carrying a water jar; furnished with a water jar (see also kāmaṇḍaluka)

kamati

pr. 3 sg. goes, goes towards; proceeds, makes progress; gains a footing, has effect.

kamanīya

mfn. & neuter desirable; lovely; beautiful; desirable thing.

kamamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see kamati)

kamalapādukā

feminine a slipper made of kamala grass; (or of lotus leaf [?].

kampati

pr. 3 sg. trembles, shakes; is moved; wavers.

kampayati

kampayi

aor. 3 sg. (see kampayati)

kampeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also kampayati) causes to shake or tremble (see kampati)

kampenta

part. pr. mfn. (see kampeti)

kambala

mfn. & m. neuter

  1. (mfn.) woolen, made of wool.
  2. (m.n.) a woollen cloth or blanket or shawl (very often ratta- or paṇḍu-); a blanket or shawl.
kambalasukhuma

neuter & mfn. very fine woolen cloth; made of very fine woolen cloth (see kambala)

kambaliya

mfn. & neuter (from kambala) woolen; of woolen cloth; woolen cloth (see also kambalīya)

kambalīya

mfn. & neuter (from kambala) woolen; of woolen cloth; woolen cloth (see also kambaliya)

>
kamma

neuter

    1. work, occupation; activity, performance.
    2. act, deed, action or actions of moral import (producing for the agent an inevitable result or consequence in the same or another life; the action appears to exist in some sense until the effect is completed)
  2. an official act of the saṅgha (i.e. an action or ceremony agreed on and ratified by a properly constituted group of bhikkhus).
kammakata

mfn. disciplined by an official act of the saṅgha (see kamma)

kammakara

masculine ~ī, feminine doing work; a worker; a hired laborer or servant (see kamma)

kammakāra

masculine ~ī, feminine working; a servant; a laborer (see kamma)

kammakāraka

m(fn). (one) who or which is competent to enact an official act of the saṅgha (see kamma)

kammakāraṇa

neuter (also kammakāraṇā) torture, torment, pain; punishment (see kamma)

kammakāraṇā

neuter (also kammakāraṇa) torture, torment, pain; punishment (see kamma)

kammañña

mfn. ready or fit for any act, ready or fit for use (see also kammaniya and kammaṇiya)

kammaṭṭhāna

neuter kind of activity; occupation (see kamma)

kammaṇiya

mfn. ready or fit for any act, ready or fit for use (see also kammañña and kammaniya)

kammadheyya

neuter work activity (see kamma)

kammaniya

mfn. ready or fit for any act, ready or fit for use (see also kammañña and kammaṇiya)

kammanta

masculine (& n.) action; work, task, business, occupation (esp. farming, agriculture); place of work (esp. the fields).

kammapatha

masculine action, activity; way of acting; course of action (see kamma)

kammappatta

mfn. competent to enact an official act of the saṅgha; suitable or sufficient to enact an official act of the saṅgha (see kamma)

kammayanta

neuter the force or compulsion of action (see kamma)

kammayantavighāṭana

mfn. destroying the force or compulsion of action (see kammayanta)

kammavācā

feminine he statement or text of an official act of the saṅgha (for which silence is assent) (see kamma)

kammavāda

mfn. holding the theory that actions have consequences (in the same or a future life) (see kamma)

kammavādi(n)

mfn.id. holding the theory that actions have consequences (in the same or a future life) (see kamma)

kammassaka

mfn. with (past) actions as one’s property or responsibility; being the owner of (the consequences of) one’s actions (see kamma)

kammāra

masculine a smith; a metalworker.

kammāraggarī

kammāraputta

masculine a smith’s (see kammāra)

kammārabhaṇḍu

masculine a shaven-headed metalworker (see kammāra)

  2. (n.) a spot; a stain, a blemish.

kammārāma

kammāvaraṇa

mfn. obstruction by (past) actions (see kamma)

kammika

m(fn). one who acts, who performs an action; an administrator; a worker; one who enacts an official act of the saṅgha.

mfn. healthy; in good spirits; sound, fit; ready (for); capable, clever; proper, fitting (see also kalla)

kātūna

absol. having done or made.

kānana

neuter a wood, a forest; a large wood.

kānāmā

feminine of what name? called what? (see also kiṃnāma, kinnāma, konāma and kenāmā)

kāpurisa

masculine a worthless or contemptible man; an inferior person.

kāpotaka

mf(-ikā)n. connected with a pigeon;

  1. of the color of a pigeon, dull white, grey.
  2. (according to commentary) of the color of a pigeon’s foot, red (?).
kāma

masculine neuter

  1. (m.) wish, desire; love; longing.
  2. (m.n.) pleasure of the senses; sensual enjoyment; esp. sexual pleasure; the objects of pleasure, what gives pleasure to the senses.
kāmaṃ

acc. adv. according to one ‘s wish or desire; as one pleases, willingly; as you please; please; esp. (usually with imperat.) let them… as they please; even if…; kāmaṃ … na (or mā) …, even if… not…; rather let…than that… (see kāma)

kāmakāmi(n)

mfn. following one’s various desires, indulging one’s desires; subject to desire for sensual pleasures (see kāma)

kāmakara

mfn. (also kāmaṇkara) (the power of) fulfilling the desires (of anyone); (the power of) acting as one likes (see kāma)

kāmakāma

ind. (also kāmakāma), out of desire for pleasures of the senses (see kāma)

kāmakāra

masculine (also kāmaṇkara) (the power of) fulfilling the desires (of (the power of) fulfilling one’s desires, acting as one likes (see kāma)

kāmakāriya

mfn. acting as one likes, acting willfully (see kāma)

kāmagavesi(n)

masculine seeking pleasure of the senses (see kāma)

kāmaguṇa

masculine

  1. desire, passion.
  2. (usually kāmagunā, m.pl [and ~āni, n.pl]), the strand(s) of (what furnishes) sensual pleasure, the subdivisions or classes of the objects of pleasure (see kāma)
kāmacāgi(n)

mfn. who gives up sensual pleasures (see kāma)

kāmacchanda

masculine desire that is appetite, sensual appetite, appetite for sensual pleasure (the first of the nīvaraṇas and one of the saṃyojanas) (see kāma)

kāmaṇkara

mfn. (also kāmakara) (the power of) fulfilling the desires (of anyone); (the power of) acting as one likes (see kāma)

kāmaṇḍaluka

masculine f., neuter carrying a water jar; furnished with a water jar (see also kamaṇḍaluka)

kāmadhātu

feminine

  1. the (psychological) element of desire (for sensual pleasure).
  2. the domain of sensory experience; existence subject to sensual experience and desire (see kāma)
kāmandha

mfn. made blind by passion; blind as to sensual pleasures (see kāma)

kāmabhava

masculine

  1. existence in a kāmaloka; existence subject to sensual experience and desire.
  2. (according to commentaries) sensual desire and existence (see kāma)
kāmabhogi(n)

mf(n.) gratifying desires for sensual pleasures, indulging in pleasures of the senses; esp. (one) who indulges in sexual pleasure, i.e. (one) who is not celibate, not a bhikkhu or bhikkhuni (see kāma)

kāmamayika

mfn. arising from the pleasure of the senses (see kāma)

kāmayati

pr. 3 sg. wishes, desires; loves (see also kāmeti)

kāmayamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see kāmayati)

kāmayāna

part. pr. mfn. (see kāmayati)

kāmarati

feminine

  1. delight in pleasures of the senses, esp. in sexual pleasures; sensual enjoyment.
  2. desire which is sexual longing, sexual desire (see kāma)
kāmarāga

masculine desire that is passion; passionate desire for sensual pleasures, esp. for sexual pleasure (see kāma)

kāmalāpi(n)

mfn. saying whatever one wants; chattering however one wishes (see kāma)

kāmalābhābhijappi(n)

mfn. who desires to obtain sensual pleasures (see kāma)

kāmavitakka

masculine thought concerned with pleasures of the senses; a lustful thought (see kāma)

kāmasukhallikānuyoga

masculine devotion to the enjoyment of sensual pleasures (see kāma)

kāmahetukaṃ

ind. because of sensual pleasures; on account of sensual desire (see kāma)

kāmādhikaraṇaṃ

ind. on account of desire, in consequence of desire (see kāma)

kāmāvacara

mfn. belonging to the sphere of sensual experience (kāmadhātu) (see kāma)

kāmitthī

feminine a woman for sexual pleasure (see kāma)

kāmūpapatti

feminine existence in (a sphere of) sexual experience (see kāma)

kāmūpasaṃhita

mfn. connected with desire or with sensual pleasure (see kāma)

kāmūpādāna

neuter grasping sensual pleasures; the fuel that is sensual pleasure (see kāma)

kāmeti

pr. 3 sg. wishes, desires; loves (see also kāmayati)

kāya

masculine

  1. the body, the physical body; sometimes the material form (of a particular existence) as opposed to the mental faculties, sometimes the assemblage of all five khandhas; the body is
    1. the experiencer of sensation and feeling, either (a) generally (physically and/or mentally); or (b) specifically, as one of the organs of sense or perception.
    2. the performer of action
  2. the main part of the body, the trunk; the trunk of a tree.
  3. a collection, assemblage, group; totality, mass.
kāyagata

mfn. relating to the body; directed on the body (see kāya)

kāyagatāsati

feminine mindfulness centered on the body; (se kāya)

kāyadaḍḍhibahula

masculine (also kāyadaḷhībahula) intent on strengthening the body; concerned with physical well being (see kña)

kāyadaḷhībahula

masculine (also kāyadaḍḍhibahula) intent on strengthening the body; concerned with physical well being (see kña)

kāyadhātu

f the constituent element that is the body (as a sense organ) (see kāya)

kāyanvaya

mfn. linked to the body, dependent on the body (see kāya)

kāyapariyantika

mfn. co-terminus with the body, coming to an end with the body (see kāya)

kāyaparihārika

mfn. (also kāyaparihāriya) [merely] protecting, sustaining the body (see kāya)

kāyaparihāriya

mfn. (also kāyaparihārika) [merely] protecting, sustaining the body (see kāya)

kāyappakopa

masculine physical tumult; rage (see kāya)

kāyappacālaka

neuter shaking, swaying the body (see kāya)

kāyappacālakaṃ

ind. making the body tremble; shaking, swaying the body (see kāya)

kāya(p)paṭibaddha

mfn. tied, bound to the body;

  1. dependent on the body.
  2. (what is) attached to the body (see kāya)
kāyabandhana

neuter (& m.) a belt, a girdle (see kāya)

kāyabhāvanā

feminine physical development or training (see kāya)

kāyamānasika

mfn. connected with the body and mind (see kāya)

kāyaviññeyya

mfn. cognizable by the sense organ that is the body (see kāya)

kāyasakkhi(n)

masculine one who has (physically) experienced (all) the stages of the jhānas (see kāya)

kāyasaṅkhāra

masculine a bodily motive force; physical motion (see kāya)

kāyāyatana

neuter the sense organ that is the body (see kāya)

kāyānupassana

neuter ~ā, feminine contemplation of the body (see kāya)

kāyānupassi(n)

mfn. considering contemplation of the body (see kāya)

kāyika

mfn. relating to the body, physical; experienced by or in the body; performed by the body.

kāyindriya

neuter the sense faculty that is the body (see kāya)

kāyura

neuter a bracelet (worn on the upper arm); an arm-guard; (according to commentaries) a neck-ornament, a necklace (see also kāyūra)

kāyūpaga

mfn. going to (a new) body (see kāya)

kāyūra

neuter a bracelet (worn on the upper arm); an arm-guard; (according to commentaries) a neck-ornament, a necklace (see also kāyura)

kāra

mf(~ī)n. & m. (& n.)

  1. (mfn. and m.f.) doing, making; a maker, a worker.
  2. (m. and n.) making; acting; act; an act of homage or service (esp. involving a gift).
kāraka

masculine n. ~ā, feminine (m.f)

  1. (one) who makes or does or produces; the actor (in an action); the perpetrator (of a crime).
  2. (one) who performs a service; a servant; a benefactor.
kārakasaṅgha

masculine the saṅgha which performs a formal act; the enacting saṅgha (see kāra)

kārakāraka

mfn. who does acts of homage or service (see kāra)

kāraṇa

neuter action; proper action; special action, task, feat.

kāraṇā1

abl. because of; for the sake of (+gen. or ifc) (see kāraṇa)

kāraṇā2

feminine torture, pain; punishment.

kāraṇīka

masculine (from kāranā2) a torturer; an executioner.

kāraṇdava

masculine chaff; sweepings.

kārabhedaka

m(fn)n. (one) who breaks out of confinement; a jail-breaker (see kārā)

kāraya(t)

part. pr. mfn. (see kārayati)

kārayati

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also kāreti) causes to do or make, causes to perform or carry out or suffer; has (something) done or made; deals with (with an act of the saṅgha); administers, supervises (the working of); occupies a position (of power), wields (a particular authority) (see karoti)

kārayamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see kārayati)

kāraye

opt. 3 sg. (see kārayati)

kārayiṃ

aor. 3 sg. (see kārayati)

kārā

feminine a prison; confinement.

kārāpana

neuter having something made or done; dealing with (with an act of the saṅgha)

kārāpayati

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also kārāpeti) cause to make or do; has (something) made or done (see karoti)

kārāpita

pp mfn. caused to be made or done (see kārāpeti)

kārāpiyamāna

part. pr. mfn. (see kārāpeti)

kārāpetabba

fpp mfn. (see kārāpeti)

kārāpeti

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also kārāpayati) cause to make or do; has (something) made or done (see karoti)

kārāpetvā

absol. (see kārāpeti)

kārāpesi

aor. 3 sg. (see kārāpeti)

kārita

pp mfn. caused to be made (see kāreti)

kāriyamāna

pass. part. pr. mfn. (see kāreti)

kāruka

masculine a maker; an artisan.

kāruñña

neuter & mfn. compassion.

kāruññata

feminine abstr. compassion (see karuñña)

kāruṇika

mfn. compassionate; full of compassion.

kāretabba

fpp mfn. (see kāreti)

kāreta(r)

masculine one who causes; one who causes or instigates to do; one who deals with (with an act of the saṅgha).

kāreti

caus. pr. 3 sg. (also kārayati) causes to do or make, causes to perform or carry out or suffer; has (something) done or made; deals with (with an act of the saṅgha); administers, supervises (the working of); occupies a position (of power), wields (a particular authority) (see karoti)

kārenta

part. pr. mfn. (see kāreti)

kāreyya

opt. 3 sg. (see kāreti)

kāreyyāma

1 plural (see kāreti)

kāreyyuṃ

3 plural (see kāreti)

kāresi

aor. 3 sg. (see kāreti)

kāressaṃ

1 sg. (see kāreti)

kāressati

fut. 3 sg. (see kāreti)

kāla1

masculine time;

    1. a fixed point of time; a period of time; time of day; time of year; time (as past, present or future); grammatical time, the time of the action of a verb; tense.
    2. a particular time; an appointed time; esp. the time for a meal (morning and evening, or, for bhikkhus, morning); the morning
  2. the proper time for (gen., dat., inf., or yaṃ + opt.); the right time; a suitable time.
  3. time as lifetime; time as destroyer; death.
kāla2

mf(~ā & ī)n. m. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) black; dark.
  2. (m.) the dark half of the month, the dark fortnight (when the moon is on the wane) (see also kāḷa)
kālakata

mfn. & neuter (also kālakata)

  1. (mfn.) who has died; dead; a dead person.
  2. (n.) death (see kāla)
kālaṃ karoti

(?) dies (see karoti and kāla)

kālaka

mf(-ikā)n. black; dark; black with dirt (see also kāḷaka)

kālakā

feminine a squirrel (see also kāḷakā)

kālakiriyā

feminine (also kālaṇkiriyā) death (see kāla)

kālaṇkata

mfn. & neuter (also kālaṇkata)

  1. (mfn.) who has died; dead; a dead person.
  2. (n.) death (see kāla)
kālaṇkiriyā

feminine (also kālaṇiriyā) death (see kāla)

kālacāri(n)

mfn. acting at the right time; going (for alms) at a suitable time (see kāla)

kālacīvara

neuter robe-material given during the appointed period (to be used and allotted by the saṅgha (see kāla)

kālaññu

mfn. knowing the right or a suitable time (to do something) (see kāla)

kālappavedana

neuter making known that it is time; an announcement of the time (see kāla)

kālayuttaṃ

ind. suitably for the time or occasion; when it is fitting for a particular time (see kāla)

kālavato

ind. (from kāla) in good time; early (in the morning)

kālavādi(n)

mfn. speaking at the proper time, at a suitable time (see kāla)

kālasseva

gen. in good time; early in the morning (see kāla)

kālāgata

mfn. coming at the right time; produced at a suitable time (see kāla)

kālābhata

mfn. produced by passing of time (see kāla)

kālika

mfn. dependent on time; relating to or limited to a particular time (now or in the future, i.e. temporary or delayed); what is dependent on time; what belongs to the future.

kāle

loc. at the right time; at a suitable time (often: in the morning); in due course (see kāla)

kālena

instr. at the right time; at a suitable time; in good time; in the morning (see kāla)

kālena kālaṃ

(?) from time to time (see kālena)

kāḷa

mf(~ā & ī)n. m. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) black; dark.
  2. (m.) the dark half of the month, the dark fortnight (when the moon is on the wane) (see also kāla)
kāḷaka

mf(-ikā)n. black; dark; black with dirt (see also kālaka)

kāḷakā

feminine a squirrel (see also kālakā)

kāḷajallikā

feminine a black spot (see kāla)

kāḷapakkha

masculine the dark half of the month, the dark fortnight (when the moon is on the wane).

kāḷapabba

neuter the knot or joint of a kālā plant (see also kāḷāpabba)

kāḷaloṇa

neuter a kind of black salt (see kāḷa)

kāḷavaṇṇa

neuter a black wash, a black plaster (see kāḷa)

kāḷavaṇṇakata

mfn. treated with black wash, smeared with black plaster (see kāḷavaṇṇa)

kāḷasāma

mfn. (also kālasāmaka) black and/or dark brown (see kāla)

kāḷasāmaka

mfn. (also kālasāma) black and/or dark brown (see kāla)

kāḷānusāri

masculine (or kāḷānusāri[n]?) a fragrant root; a powder made from this root (see kāla)

kāḷānusārika

masculine (also kāḷānusāriya) a fragrant root; a powder made from this root (see kāla)

kāḷānusāri(n)

masculine (also kāḷānusāri) a fragrant root; a powder made from this root (see kāla)

kāḷānusāriya

masculine (also kāḷānusārika) a fragrant root; a powder made from this root (see kāla)

kāḷāpabba

neuter the knot or joint of a kālā plant (see also kāḷapabba)

kāviya

mfn.

  1. (mfn.) produced by a sage or poet.
  2. (n.) poetry; poetry-writing (see also kāveyya)
kāveyya

mfn.

  1. (mfn.) produced by a sage or poet.
  2. (n.) poetry; poetry-writing (see also kāviya)
kāveyyamatta

mfn. intoxicated with poetry-writing; in a muse of poetic inspiration (see kāveyya)

kāsa1

masculine a species of grass.

kāsa2

masculine a cough.

kāsaṃ

1 sg. (see karoti)

kāsāya

mfn. of a yellowish-red color; dyed a reddish color.

kāsāyavattha

mfn. wearing a yellowish-red robe; wearing yellowish red clothes (see kāsāya)

kāsāyavatthavasana

mfn. wearing a yellowish-red robe (see kāsāya)

kāsāyavasana

mfn. wearing a yellowish-red robe (see kāsāya)

kāsāyavāsi(n)

mfn. wearing a yellowish-red robe (see kāsāya)

kāsāva

masculine neuter a yellowish-red cloth or robe (the dress of those outside society, esp. ascetics, bhikkhus, bhikkhīs).

kāsāvakaṇṭha

mfn. having a yellowish-red throat, i.e. wearing a yellowish-red robe or cloth (see kāsāva)

kāsāvaṭa

masculine a bath attendant; a barber.

kāsāvavattha

mfn. wearing a yellowish-red robe (see kāsāva)

kāsika

mfn. coming from Kāsi (of cloth: of fine cotton or muslin; of sandal: of fine quality); (also kāsiya)

kāsikacandana

neuter fine sandal from Kāsi (see kāsika)

kāsikasukhuma

neuter fine garment of muslin from from Kāsi (see kāsika)

kāsiya

mfn. coming from Kāsi (of cloth: of fine cotton or muslin; of sandal: of fine quality); (also kāsika)

kāhasi

2 sg. (see karoti)

kāhāmi

1 sg. (see karoti)

kāhisi

2 sg. (see karoti)

kiṃ

neuter interrog. very often strengthened by nu, nu kho, (s)su, ssa),

  1. interrogative particle.
  2. why? how?.
  3. (+ ins tr.) what is the use of …, away with …, no more of …; kiṃ is often followed by other particles (see also ka)
kiṃ aṅga

interrog. how much more? how much less? never mind … (see kiṃ)

kiṃ aññatra

interrog. what but, what else is this but? (see aññatra)

kiṃ kata

mfn. having what done (to it)? (i.e.: what has happened to?); having done what? (see kiṃ)

kiṃ kayira

(?) how could … be relevant? what would one do with …? (see kayira)

kiṃ karaṇīya

neuter duty, any duty at all (see kiṃ)

kiṃ kāraṇaṃ

adv. for what reason? why? (see kiṃ)

kiṃ kāraṇā

adv. for what reason? why? (see kiṃ)

kiṃ kārapaṭissāvi(n)

mfn. ready for any action required; agreeing to all (requests for) service (see kiṃ)

kiṃ kusalagavesi(n)

mfn. searching for (the knowledge of) what is right or good (see kiṃ)

kiṃ kusalānu-esi(n)

mfn. id. searching for (the knowledge of) what is right or good (see kiṃ)

kiṃ gatika

mfn. producing what future course? (see kiṃ)

kiṃ jacca

mfn. of what class? of what family? (see kiṃ)

kiṃ jātika

mfn. produced by what? having what as its origin? (see kiṃ)

kiṃ diṭṭhika

mfn. holding what beliefs? having what theories? (see kiṃ)

kiṃ vādi(n)

mfn. professing which doctrine? declaring which view? (see kiṃ)

kiṃsuka

masculine & neuter (m.) the tree Butea frondosa (with orange-red blossoms); (n.) its blossom.

kiṃnāma

mfn. of what name? called what? (see also kānāmā, kinnāma, konāma and kenāmā)

kikiṭa

mfn. seething; hot; blazing hot (see also kikita and kīkita)

kikita

mfn. seething; hot; blazing hot (see also kikiṭa and kīkita)

kiñ carahi

interrog. how then? why then? how is it that …? (see kiṃ)

kiñcāpi

(?) although (see kiṃ)

kiṅkaṇikā

feminine a small belt (see also kiṅkiṇikā)

kiṅkaṇī

feminine a small bell (see also kiṅkiṇī)

kiṅkiṇikajāla

neuter a string or network of small bells (see kiṅkinikā)

kiṅkiṇikā

feminine a small bell (see also kiṅkaṇikā)

kiṅkiṇī

feminine a small bell (see also kiṅkaṇī)

kicca

fpp mfn. n.,

  1. (mfn. and n.) (what is) to be done or made; business, affair; duty, service; purpose, need; something to be done, that must be done; job, task.
  2. (n.) see kiccādhikaraṇa (see kata)
kiccakara

mfn. doing what should be done, doing one’s duty; serving a purpose, useful (see kicca)

kiccakaraṇīya

neuter duty to be performed, business to be done; various duties or affairs (see kicca)

kiccakāri(n)

mfn. doing what should be done; doing one’s duty; acting rightly.

kiccayatā

feminine abstr. obligation; task, duty.

kiccākiccāni

neuter plural various duties or affairs (see kicca)

kiccādhikaraṇa

neuter a legal case or matter to be dealt with involving or connected with a formal act (of the saṅgha) (see kicca)

kiccha

mfn. & neuter

  1. (mfn.) causing trouble or pain; attended with pain or labor; obtained with difficulty.
  2. (n.) difficulty, trouble; pain.
kicchati

pr. 3 sg. is in difficulty; is distressed; finds difficult.

kicchanta

part. pr. mfn. (see kicchati)

kicchalābhi(n)

mfn. obtaining with great difficulty; only with great trouble (see kiccha)

kicchā

abl. adv. with difficulty; with great trouble (see kiccha)

kicchena

instr. adv. with great difficulty; with great trouble (see kiccha)

kiñcana1

neuter (& m.) something; anything; (as abstracted from akiñcana, interpreted as) an impediment or defilement.

kiñcana2

adv. at all, in any way (see also kiñcanaṃ)

kiñcanaṃ

adv. at all, in any way (see also kiñcanaṃ)

kiñcanatā

feminine abstr. (the state of being) an impediment or defilement; (the state of being) a possession, property (see kiñcana)

kiñcikkhabhāvanā

feminine the producing of some material gain (?) (see kiñcikkha)

kiñjakkha

masculine neuter the filament of a plant, esp. of a lotus.

kiṭika

masculine ~ā, feminine a screen; a plate of wood or metal (?).

kiṭṭha

neuter a cornfield; growing corn (grain).

kiṭṭhasambādha

masculine (or mfn.) an abundance of grain; (or with an abundance of corn; crammed with corn).

kiṭṭhāda

mfn. who eats grain (see kiṭṭha)

kiṭṭhārakkha

masculine a guard of cornfields.

pr. 3 sg. buys; purchases (see also kināti and kīṇāti)

aor. 3 plural (see kiṇāti)

kiṇitvā

absol. (see kiṇāti)
